async def generate_llm_function_response( prompt: str, tools: list[dict[str, typing.Any]], model: str = 'gpt-4.1-mini', instructions: Optional[str] = None, system_prompt: Optional[str] = None, temperature: Optional[float] = None, max_tokens: Optional[int] = None, tool_choice: Union[str, dict[str, Any], NoneType] = None, enable_web_search: bool = False, reasoning_effort: Optional[str] = None, images: Optional[list[str | dict[str, Any]]] = None, files: Optional[list[str | dict[str, Any]]] = None, response_format: Optional[dict[str, Any]] = None, execute_tools: bool = False, tool_executors: Optional[dict[str, Callable[..., Any]]] = None, return_all_calls: bool = False, client: Optional[src.llm.OpenAIClient] = None, **kwargs: Any) -> dict[str, typing.Any] | list[dict[str, typing.Any]] | openai.types.chat.chat_completion.ChatCompletion:

 32async def generate_llm_function_response(
 33    prompt: str,
 34    tools: list[dict[str, Any]],
 35    model: str = "gpt-4.1-mini",
 36    instructions: Optional[str] = None,
 37    system_prompt: Optional[str] = None,
 38    temperature: Optional[float] = None,
 39    max_tokens: Optional[int] = None,
 40    tool_choice: Optional[str | dict[str, Any]] = None,
 41    enable_web_search: bool = False,
 42    reasoning_effort: Optional[str] = None,
 43    images: Optional[list[str | dict[str, Any]]] = None,
 44    files: Optional[list[str | dict[str, Any]]] = None,
 45    response_format: Optional[dict[str, Any]] = None,
 46    execute_tools: bool = False,
 47    tool_executors: Optional[dict[str, Callable[..., Any]]] = None,
 48    return_all_calls: bool = False,
 49    client: Optional[OpenAIClient] = None,
 50    **kwargs: Any,
 51) -> dict[str, Any] | list[dict[str, Any]] | ChatCompletion:
 52    """Generate an LLM response with function calling and structured outputs.
 53
 54    This function provides a convenient interface for generating LLM responses
 55    with function calling capabilities. It can parse function call arguments
 56    and optionally execute the tools, returning structured outputs.
 57
 58    Args:
 59        prompt: The user prompt/message content.
 60        tools: List of tool/function definitions. Each tool should have a
 61            'type' field (typically "function") and a 'function' field with
 62            'name', 'description', and 'parameters' (JSON schema).
 63        model: Model to use for completion (default: "gpt-4").
 64        instructions: Optional instructions to include in the system message.
 65            This is combined with system_prompt if both are provided.
 66        system_prompt: Optional system prompt. If provided, this takes precedence
 67            over instructions. If neither is provided, no system message is added.
 68        temperature: Sampling temperature (0-2). Higher values make output
 69            more random. Not used with o1 models.
 70        max_tokens: Maximum tokens to generate.
 71        tool_choice: Control which tools the model can use. Can be "auto",
 72            "none", or a specific tool definition. Defaults to "auto" if not provided.
 73        enable_web_search: Enable web search capabilities (default: False).
 74            NOTE: Currently not supported - OpenAI API only supports 'function' and 'custom' tool types.
 75            This parameter is ignored and will log a warning if set to True.
 76        reasoning_effort: Reasoning effort for o1 models. Can be "low", "medium",
 77            or "high". Only applicable to o1 models.
 78        images: Optional list of image URLs or image dicts with 'type' and 'image_url'
 79            keys. Images are added to the user message content.
 80        files: Optional list of file IDs or file dicts. Files are attached to
 81            the user message.
 82        response_format: Optional response format (e.g., {"type": "json_object"}).
 83        execute_tools: If True, execute the tool calls using tool_executors and
 84            return results. If False, only parse and return the function call arguments.
 85        tool_executors: Optional dict mapping tool names to async callable functions.
 86            Required if execute_tools=True. Each function should accept keyword arguments
 87            matching the tool's parameters schema.
 88        return_all_calls: If True and multiple tool calls are made, return a list
 89            of all tool call results. If False, return only the first tool call result.
 90        client: Optional OpenAIClient instance. If not provided, uses the
 91            default singleton client.
 92        **kwargs: Additional parameters to pass to the chat completion API.
 93
 94    Returns:
 95        If execute_tools=False:
 96            - If return_all_calls=False: dict with 'function_name' and 'arguments' (parsed)
 97            - If return_all_calls=True: list of dicts, one per tool call
 98        If execute_tools=True:
 99            - If return_all_calls=False: dict with 'function_name', 'arguments', and 'result'
100            - If return_all_calls=True: list of dicts with execution results
101        If no tool calls are made: returns the full ChatCompletion object
102
103    Raises:
104        ValueError: If invalid parameters are provided (e.g., execute_tools=True
105            without tool_executors, or no tools provided).
106        Exception: If API call fails or tool execution fails.
107
108    Example:
109        ```python
110        # Define a tool
111        tools = [
112            {
113                "type": "function",
114                "function": {
115                    "name": "get_weather",
116                    "description": "Get the current weather",
117                    "parameters": {
118                        "type": "object",
119                        "properties": {
120                            "location": {"type": "string"},
121                            "unit": {"type": "string", "enum": ["celsius", "fahrenheit"]}
122                        },
123                        "required": ["location"]
124                    }
125                }
126            }
127        ]
128
129        # Get structured output (just parse function call)
130        result = await generate_llm_function_response(
131            prompt="What's the weather in San Francisco?",
132            tools=tools,
133            model="gpt-4"
134        )
135        print(result["function_name"])  # "get_weather"
136        print(result["arguments"])  # {"location": "San Francisco", "unit": "fahrenheit"}
137
138        # Execute the tool and get results
139        async def get_weather(location: str, unit: str = "fahrenheit"):
140            return {"temperature": 72, "condition": "sunny"}
141
142        tool_executors = {"get_weather": get_weather}
143        result = await generate_llm_function_response(
144            prompt="What's the weather in San Francisco?",
145            tools=tools,
146            model="gpt-4",
147            execute_tools=True,
148            tool_executors=tool_executors
149        )
150        print(result["result"])  # {"temperature": 72, "condition": "sunny"}
151
152        # Multiple tool calls
153        result = await generate_llm_function_response(
154            prompt="Get weather for SF and NYC",
155            tools=tools,
156            model="gpt-4",
157            execute_tools=True,
158            tool_executors=tool_executors,
159            return_all_calls=True
160        )
161        # Returns list of results for each tool call
162        ```
163    """
164    # Validate inputs
165    if not tools:
166        raise ValueError("tools parameter is required for function calling")
167
168    if execute_tools and not tool_executors:
169        raise ValueError(
170            "tool_executors is required when execute_tools=True. "
171            "Provide a dict mapping tool names to async callable functions."
172        )
173
174    # Use provided client or get default singleton
175    if client is None:
176        client = await get_client()
177
178    # Build messages list
179    messages: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
180
181    # Add system message if provided
182    if system_prompt or instructions:
183        system_content = system_prompt or instructions
184        messages.append({"role": "system", "content": system_content})
185
186    # Build user message content
187    user_content: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
188
189    # Add text prompt
190    if prompt:
191        user_content.append({"type": "text", "text": prompt})
192
193    # Add images if provided
194    if images:
195        for image in images:
196            if isinstance(image, str):
197                # Assume it's a URL
198                user_content.append(
199                    {
200                        "type": "image_url",
201                        "image_url": {"url": image},
202                    }
203                )
204            elif isinstance(image, dict):
205                # Assume it's already formatted
206                user_content.append(image)
207            else:
208                raise ValueError(f"Invalid image format: {image}. Expected str (URL) or dict.")
209
210    # Build user message
211    user_message: dict[str, Any] = {"role": "user"}
212
213    # If we have multiple content items or files, use content array
214    if len(user_content) > 1 or files:
215        user_message["content"] = user_content
216    elif len(user_content) == 1:
217        # Single text content can be a string
218        if user_content[0]["type"] == "text":
219            user_message["content"] = user_content[0]["text"]
220        else:
221            user_message["content"] = user_content
222    else:
223        # No content (shouldn't happen, but handle gracefully)
224        user_message["content"] = prompt or ""
225
226    # Add file attachments if provided
227    if files:
228        attachments = []
229        for file in files:
230            if isinstance(file, str):
231                # Assume it's a file ID
232                attachments.append({"file_id": file, "tools": [{"type": "file_search"}]})
233            elif isinstance(file, dict):
234                # Assume it's already formatted
235                attachments.append(file)
236            else:
237                raise ValueError(f"Invalid file format: {file}. Expected str (file_id) or dict.")
238        user_message["attachments"] = attachments
239
240    messages.append(user_message)
241
242    # Validate reasoning_effort if provided
243    if reasoning_effort is not None:
244        valid_efforts = ["low", "medium", "high"]
245        if reasoning_effort not in valid_efforts:
246            raise ValueError(
247                f"Invalid reasoning_effort: {reasoning_effort}. " f"Must be one of {valid_efforts}."
248            )
249
250    # Default tool_choice to "auto" if not provided
251    if tool_choice is None:
252        tool_choice = "auto"
253
254    # Call the client's chat_completion method
255    try:
256        response = await client.chat_completion(
257            messages=messages,
258            model=model,
259            temperature=temperature,
260            max_tokens=max_tokens,
261            stream=False,  # Function calls don't work well with streaming
262            enable_web_search=enable_web_search,
263            reasoning_effort=reasoning_effort,
264            tools=tools,
265            tool_choice=tool_choice,
266            response_format=response_format,
267            **kwargs,
268        )
269
270        # Check if response is a ChatCompletion (should always be, since stream=False)
271        if not isinstance(response, ChatCompletion):
272            logger.warning(
273                "Unexpected response type. Expected ChatCompletion, got streaming response."
274            )
275            # Type narrowing: if it's not ChatCompletion, it must be one of the expected return types
276            # This should not happen with stream=False, but handle it gracefully
277            return response  # type: ignore[return-value]
278
279        # Extract tool calls from the response
280        message = response.choices[0].message
281        tool_calls = message.tool_calls
282
283        # If no tool calls, return the full response
284        if not tool_calls:
285            logger.warning("No tool calls found in LLM response. Returning full ChatCompletion.")
286            return response
287
288        # Parse tool calls
289        parsed_calls = []
290        for tool_call in tool_calls:
291            if not isinstance(tool_call, ChatCompletionMessageToolCall):
292                logger.warning(f"Unexpected tool call type: {type(tool_call)}")
293                continue
294
295            function_name = tool_call.function.name
296            function_args_str = tool_call.function.arguments
297
298            # Parse JSON arguments
299            try:
300                function_args = json.loads(function_args_str)
301            except json.JSONDecodeError as e:
302                logger.error(f"Failed to parse function arguments for {function_name}: {e}")
303                raise ValueError(
304                    f"Invalid JSON in function arguments for {function_name}: {function_args_str}"
305                ) from e
306
307            parsed_call = {
308                "function_name": function_name,
309                "arguments": function_args,
310                "call_id": tool_call.id,
311            }
312
313            # Execute tool if requested
314            if execute_tools:
315                if tool_executors is None:
316                    raise ValueError("tool_executors is required when execute_tools=True")
317                if function_name not in tool_executors:
318                    raise ValueError(
319                        f"No executor found for tool '{function_name}'. "
320                        f"Available executors: {list(tool_executors.keys())}"
321                    )
322
323                executor = tool_executors[function_name]
324                if not callable(executor):
325                    raise ValueError(f"Tool executor for '{function_name}' is not callable")
326                try:
327                    # Execute the tool with parsed arguments
328                    result = await executor(**function_args)
329                    parsed_call["result"] = result
330                except Exception as e:
331                    logger.error(f"Tool execution failed for {function_name}: {e}", exc_info=True)
332                    parsed_call["error"] = str(e)
333                    parsed_call["result"] = None
334
335            parsed_calls.append(parsed_call)
336
337        # Return based on return_all_calls flag
338        if return_all_calls:
339            return parsed_calls
340        else:
341            return parsed_calls[0] if parsed_calls else response
342
343    except Exception as e:
344        logger.error(f"Failed to generate LLM function response: {e}")
345        raise

Generate an LLM response with function calling and structured outputs.

This function provides a convenient interface for generating LLM responses with function calling capabilities. It can parse function call arguments and optionally execute the tools, returning structured outputs.

Args: prompt: The user prompt/message content. tools: List of tool/function definitions. Each tool should have a 'type' field (typically "function") and a 'function' field with 'name', 'description', and 'parameters' (JSON schema). model: Model to use for completion (default: "gpt-4"). instructions: Optional instructions to include in the system message. This is combined with system_prompt if both are provided. system_prompt: Optional system prompt. If provided, this takes precedence over instructions. If neither is provided, no system message is added. temperature: Sampling temperature (0-2). Higher values make output more random. Not used with o1 models. max_tokens: Maximum tokens to generate. tool_choice: Control which tools the model can use. Can be "auto", "none", or a specific tool definition. Defaults to "auto" if not provided. enable_web_search: Enable web search capabilities (default: False). NOTE: Currently not supported - OpenAI API only supports 'function' and 'custom' tool types. This parameter is ignored and will log a warning if set to True. reasoning_effort: Reasoning effort for o1 models. Can be "low", "medium", or "high". Only applicable to o1 models. images: Optional list of image URLs or image dicts with 'type' and 'image_url' keys. Images are added to the user message content. files: Optional list of file IDs or file dicts. Files are attached to the user message. response_format: Optional response format (e.g., {"type": "json_object"}). execute_tools: If True, execute the tool calls using tool_executors and return results. If False, only parse and return the function call arguments. tool_executors: Optional dict mapping tool names to async callable functions. Required if execute_tools=True. Each function should accept keyword arguments matching the tool's parameters schema. return_all_calls: If True and multiple tool calls are made, return a list of all tool call results. If False, return only the first tool call result. client: Optional OpenAIClient instance. If not provided, uses the default singleton client. **kwargs: Additional parameters to pass to the chat completion API.

Returns: If execute_tools=False: - If return_all_calls=False: dict with 'function_name' and 'arguments' (parsed) - If return_all_calls=True: list of dicts, one per tool call If execute_tools=True: - If return_all_calls=False: dict with 'function_name', 'arguments', and 'result' - If return_all_calls=True: list of dicts with execution results If no tool calls are made: returns the full ChatCompletion object

Raises: ValueError: If invalid parameters are provided (e.g., execute_tools=True without tool_executors, or no tools provided). Exception: If API call fails or tool execution fails.

Example:



# Define a tool
tools = [
    {
        "type": "function",
        "function": {
            "name": "get_weather",
            "description": "Get the current weather",
            "parameters": {
                "type": "object",
                "properties": {
                    "location": {"type": "string"},
                    "unit": {"type": "string", "enum": ["celsius", "fahrenheit"]}
                },
                "required": ["location"]
            }
        }
    }
]

# Get structured output (just parse function call)
result = await generate_llm_function_response(
    prompt="What's the weather in San Francisco?",
    tools=tools,
    model="gpt-4"
)
print(result["function_name"])  # "get_weather"
print(result["arguments"])  # {"location": "San Francisco", "unit": "fahrenheit"}

# Execute the tool and get results
async def get_weather(location: str, unit: str = "fahrenheit"):
    return {"temperature": 72, "condition": "sunny"}

tool_executors = {"get_weather": get_weather}
result = await generate_llm_function_response(
    prompt="What's the weather in San Francisco?",
    tools=tools,
    model="gpt-4",
    execute_tools=True,
    tool_executors=tool_executors
)
print(result["result"])  # {"temperature": 72, "condition": "sunny"}

# Multiple tool calls
result = await generate_llm_function_response(
    prompt="Get weather for SF and NYC",
    tools=tools,
    model="gpt-4",
    execute_tools=True,
    tool_executors=tool_executors,
    return_all_calls=True
)
# Returns list of results for each tool call
@observe(as_type='tool')
async def generate_llm_response( prompt: str, model: str = 'gpt-4.1-mini', instructions: Optional[str] = None, system_prompt: Optional[str] = None, temperature: Optional[float] = None, max_tokens: Optional[int] = None, stream: bool = False, enable_web_search: bool = False, reasoning_effort: Optional[str] = None, images: Optional[list[str | dict[str, Any]]] = None, files: Optional[list[str | dict[str, Any]]] = None, tools: Optional[list[dict[str, Any]]] = None, tool_choice: Union[str, dict[str, Any], NoneType] = None, response_format: Optional[dict[str, Any]] = None, client: Optional[src.llm.OpenAIClient] = None, **kwargs: Any) -> Union[openai.types.chat.chat_completion.ChatCompletion, AsyncIterator[openai.types.chat.chat_completion_chunk.ChatCompletionChunk], str]: 
 30@observe(as_type="tool")
 31async def generate_llm_response(
 32    prompt: str,
 33    model: str = "gpt-4.1-mini",
 34    instructions: Optional[str] = None,
 35    system_prompt: Optional[str] = None,
 36    temperature: Optional[float] = None,
 37    max_tokens: Optional[int] = None,
 38    stream: bool = False,
 39    enable_web_search: bool = False,
 40    reasoning_effort: Optional[str] = None,
 41    images: Optional[list[str | dict[str, Any]]] = None,
 42    files: Optional[list[str | dict[str, Any]]] = None,
 43    tools: Optional[list[dict[str, Any]]] = None,
 44    tool_choice: Optional[str | dict[str, Any]] = None,
 45    response_format: Optional[dict[str, Any]] = None,
 46    client: Optional[OpenAIClient] = None,
 47    **kwargs: Any,
 48) -> ChatCompletion | AsyncIterator[ChatCompletionChunk] | str:
 49    """Generate an LLM response with flexible configuration options.
 50
 51    This function provides a convenient interface for generating LLM responses
 52    with support for various features like streaming, web search, reasoning
 53    effort, images, and files.
 54
 55    Args:
 56        prompt: The user prompt/message content.
 57        model: Model to use for completion (default: "gpt-4").
 58        instructions: Optional instructions to include in the system message.
 59            This is combined with system_prompt if both are provided.
 60        system_prompt: Optional system prompt. If provided, this takes precedence
 61            over instructions. If neither is provided, no system message is added.
 62        temperature: Sampling temperature (0-2). Higher values make output
 63            more random. Not used with o1 models.
 64        max_tokens: Maximum tokens to generate.
 65        stream: Whether to stream the response (default: False).
 66            If True, returns an AsyncIterator. If False, returns the full response.
 67        enable_web_search: Enable web search capabilities (default: False).
 68        reasoning_effort: Reasoning effort for o1 models. Can be "low", "medium",
 69            or "high". Only applicable to o1 models.
 70        images: Optional list of image URLs or image dicts with 'type' and 'image_url'
 71            keys. Images are added to the user message content.
 72        files: Optional list of file IDs or file dicts. Files are attached to
 73            the user message.
 74        tools: Optional list of tool definitions for function calling.
 75        tool_choice: Control which tools the model can use. Can be "auto",
 76            "none", or a specific tool definition.
 77        response_format: Optional response format (e.g., {"type": "json_object"}).
 78        client: Optional OpenAIClient instance. If not provided, uses the
 79            default singleton client.
 80        **kwargs: Additional parameters to pass to the chat completion API.
 81
 82    Returns:
 83        If stream=False: ChatCompletion object or str (if return_text=True in kwargs).
 84        If stream=True: AsyncIterator of ChatCompletionChunk objects.
 85
 86    Raises:
 87        ValueError: If invalid parameters are provided.
 88        Exception: If API call fails.
 89
 90    Example:
 91        ```python
 92        # Simple text generation
 93        response = await generate_llm_response(
 94            prompt="What is the capital of France?",
 95            model="gpt-4"
 96        )
 97        print(response.choices[0].message.content)
 98
 99        # With system instructions
100        response = await generate_llm_response(
101            prompt="Explain quantum computing",
102            model="gpt-4",
103            instructions="You are a helpful physics teacher. Explain concepts simply."
104        )
105
106        # Streaming response
107        async for chunk in await generate_llm_response(
108            prompt="Tell me a story",
109            model="gpt-4",
110            stream=True
111        ):
112            if chunk.choices[0].delta.content:
113                print(chunk.choices[0].delta.content, end="")
114
115        # With web search
116        response = await generate_llm_response(
117            prompt="What's the latest news about AI?",
118            model="gpt-4",
119            enable_web_search=True
120        )
121
122        # With images
123        response = await generate_llm_response(
124            prompt="What's in this image?",
125            model="gpt-4-vision-preview",
126            images=["https://example.com/image.jpg"]
127        )
128
129        # With files
130        response = await generate_llm_response(
131            prompt="Summarize this document",
132            model="gpt-4",
133            files=["file-abc123"]
134        )
135
136        # With reasoning effort (o1 models)
137        response = await generate_llm_response(
138            prompt="Solve this complex math problem step by step",
139            model="o1-preview",
140            reasoning_effort="high"
141        )
142        ```
143    """
144    # Use provided client or get default singleton
145    if client is None:
146        client = await get_client()
147
148    # Build messages list
149    messages: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
150
151    # Add system message if provided
152    if system_prompt or instructions:
153        system_content = system_prompt or instructions
154        messages.append({"role": "system", "content": system_content})
155
156    # Build user message content
157    user_content: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
158
159    # Add text prompt
160    if prompt:
161        user_content.append({"type": "text", "text": prompt})
162
163    # Add images if provided
164    if images:
165        for image in images:
166            if isinstance(image, str):
167                # Assume it's a URL
168                user_content.append(
169                    {
170                        "type": "image_url",
171                        "image_url": {"url": image},
172                    }
173                )
174            elif isinstance(image, dict):
175                # Assume it's already formatted
176                user_content.append(image)
177            else:
178                raise ValueError(f"Invalid image format: {image}. Expected str (URL) or dict.")
179
180    # Build user message
181    user_message: dict[str, Any] = {"role": "user"}
182
183    # If we have multiple content items or files, use content array
184    if len(user_content) > 1 or files:
185        user_message["content"] = user_content
186    elif len(user_content) == 1:
187        # Single text content can be a string
188        if user_content[0]["type"] == "text":
189            user_message["content"] = user_content[0]["text"]
190        else:
191            user_message["content"] = user_content
192    else:
193        # No content (shouldn't happen, but handle gracefully)
194        user_message["content"] = prompt or ""
195
196    # Add file attachments if provided
197    if files:
198        attachments = []
199        for file in files:
200            if isinstance(file, str):
201                # Assume it's a file ID
202                attachments.append({"file_id": file, "tools": [{"type": "file_search"}]})
203            elif isinstance(file, dict):
204                # Assume it's already formatted
205                attachments.append(file)
206            else:
207                raise ValueError(f"Invalid file format: {file}. Expected str (file_id) or dict.")
208        user_message["attachments"] = attachments
209
210    messages.append(user_message)
211
212    # Validate reasoning_effort if provided
213    if reasoning_effort is not None:
214        valid_efforts = ["low", "medium", "high"]
215        if reasoning_effort not in valid_efforts:
216            raise ValueError(
217                f"Invalid reasoning_effort: {reasoning_effort}. " f"Must be one of {valid_efforts}."
218            )
219
220    # Extract return_text from kwargs before passing to client
221    # (return_text is handled in this function, not by the OpenAI API)
222    return_text = kwargs.pop("return_text", False)
223
224    # Call the client's chat_completion method
225    try:
226        response = await client.chat_completion(
227            messages=messages,
228            model=model,
229            temperature=temperature,
230            max_tokens=max_tokens,
231            stream=stream,
232            enable_web_search=enable_web_search,
233            reasoning_effort=reasoning_effort,
234            tools=tools,
235            tool_choice=tool_choice,
236            response_format=response_format,
237            **kwargs,
238        )
239
240        # If streaming, return the iterator as-is
241        if stream:
242            return response
243
244        # If not streaming and return_text is requested, extract text
245        if return_text:
246            if isinstance(response, ChatCompletion):
247                return response.choices[0].message.content or ""
248            return ""
249
250        return response
251    except Exception as e:
252        logger.error(f"Failed to generate LLM response: {e}")
253        raise

Generate an LLM response with flexible configuration options.

This function provides a convenient interface for generating LLM responses with support for various features like streaming, web search, reasoning effort, images, and files.

Args: prompt: The user prompt/message content. model: Model to use for completion (default: "gpt-4"). instructions: Optional instructions to include in the system message. This is combined with system_prompt if both are provided. system_prompt: Optional system prompt. If provided, this takes precedence over instructions. If neither is provided, no system message is added. temperature: Sampling temperature (0-2). Higher values make output more random. Not used with o1 models. max_tokens: Maximum tokens to generate. stream: Whether to stream the response (default: False). If True, returns an AsyncIterator. If False, returns the full response. enable_web_search: Enable web search capabilities (default: False). reasoning_effort: Reasoning effort for o1 models. Can be "low", "medium", or "high". Only applicable to o1 models. images: Optional list of image URLs or image dicts with 'type' and 'image_url' keys. Images are added to the user message content. files: Optional list of file IDs or file dicts. Files are attached to the user message. tools: Optional list of tool definitions for function calling. tool_choice: Control which tools the model can use. Can be "auto", "none", or a specific tool definition. response_format: Optional response format (e.g., {"type": "json_object"}). client: Optional OpenAIClient instance. If not provided, uses the default singleton client. **kwargs: Additional parameters to pass to the chat completion API.

Returns: If stream=False: ChatCompletion object or str (if return_text=True in kwargs). If stream=True: AsyncIterator of ChatCompletionChunk objects.

Raises: ValueError: If invalid parameters are provided. Exception: If API call fails.

):

# With web search

    model="gpt-4",

)

# With images

    prompt="What's in this image?",
    model="gpt-4-vision-preview",
    images=["https://example.com/image.jpg"]
)

# With files

    prompt="Summarize this document",
    model="gpt-4",
    files=["file-abc123"]
)

# With reasoning effort (o1 models)

    prompt="Solve this complex math problem step by step",
    model="o1-preview",
    reasoning_effort="high"
)

async def get_acquisitions( acquisition_uuid: Optional[str] = None, acquiree_uuid: Optional[str] = None, acquirer_uuid: Optional[str] = None, acquisition_type: Optional[str] = None, acquisition_announce_date: Optional[str] = None, acquisition_announce_date_from: Optional[str] = None, acquisition_announce_date_to: Optional[str] = None, acquisition_price_usd: Optional[int] = None, acquisition_price_usd_min: Optional[int] = None, acquisition_price_usd_max: Optional[int] = None, terms: Optional[str] = None, terms_ilike: Optional[str] = None, acquirer_type: Optional[str] = None, limit: Optional[int] = None, offset: Optional[int] = None, include_organizations: bool = False, order_by: Optional[str] = None, order_direction: Optional[str] = None) -> src.contracts.tool_io.ToolOutput:

170    acquisition_uuid: Optional[str] = None,

172    acquirer_uuid: Optional[str] = None,

174    acquisition_announce_date: Optional[str] = None,
175    acquisition_announce_date_from: Optional[str] = None,

187    order_direction: Optional[str] = None,
188) -> ToolOutput:
189    """Get acquisitions matching the specified filters.
190
191    This tool queries the acquisitions table using the AcquisitionModel
192    and returns a list of acquisition records as dictionaries.
193
194    Args:
195        acquisition_uuid: Exact match for acquisition UUID (as string).
196        acquiree_uuid: Exact match for acquiree UUID (as string).
197        acquirer_uuid: Exact match for acquirer UUID (as string).
198        acquisition_type: Exact match for acquisition type.
199        acquisition_announce_date: Exact match for announce date (ISO format string).
200        acquisition_announce_date_from: Filter acquisitions on or after this date (ISO format string).
201        acquisition_announce_date_to: Filter acquisitions on or before this date (ISO format string).
202        acquisition_price_usd: Exact match for acquisition price in USD.
203        acquisition_price_usd_min: Filter acquisitions with price >= this value.
204        acquisition_price_usd_max: Filter acquisitions with price <= this value.
205        terms: Exact match for terms.
206        terms_ilike: Case-insensitive partial match for terms.
207        acquirer_type: Exact match for acquirer type.
208        limit: Maximum number of results to return.
209        offset: Number of results to skip (for pagination).
210        include_organizations: If True, includes nested organization details for
211            acquiree_uuid and acquirer_uuid. Returns AcquisitionWithOrganizations objects
212            with full organization data instead of just UUIDs.
213        order_by: Field to order results by. Must be one of: "acquisition_announce_date",
214            "acquisition_price_usd". Defaults to "acquisition_announce_date" if not specified.
215        order_direction: Direction to order results. Must be "asc" or "desc".
216            Defaults to "desc" if not specified.
217
218    Returns:
219        ToolOutput object containing:
220        - success: Whether the query succeeded
221        - result: List of acquisition records as dictionaries (if successful).
222            Each dictionary contains all fields from the Acquisition model.
223            If include_organizations=True, also includes:
224            - acquiree_organization: Full Organization object for the company being acquired
225            - acquirer_organization: Full Organization object for the acquiring company
226        - error: Error message (if failed)
227        - execution_time_ms: Time taken to execute the query
228        - metadata: Additional metadata about the execution
229
230    Example:
231        ```python
232        # Get all acquisitions
233        acquisitions = await get_acquisitions()
234
235        # Get by UUID
236        acquisition = await get_acquisitions(acquisition_uuid="123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000")
237
238        # Get acquisitions with price >= 1M USD
239        expensive = await get_acquisitions(acquisition_price_usd_min=1000000)
240
241        # Get acquisitions announced in a date range
242        recent = await get_acquisitions(
243            acquisition_announce_date_from="2020-01-01T00:00:00",
244            acquisition_announce_date_to="2023-12-31T23:59:59"
245        )
246
247        # Get acquisitions with full organization details
248        acquisitions_with_orgs = await get_acquisitions(
249            acquiree_uuid="123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
250            include_organizations=True
251        )
252
253        # Get acquisitions ordered by price (descending)
254        expensive_first = await get_acquisitions(
255            acquisition_price_usd_min=1000000,
256            order_by="acquisition_price_usd",
257            order_direction="desc"
258        )
259
260        # Get acquisitions ordered by announce date (ascending)
261        oldest_first = await get_acquisitions(
262            order_by="acquisition_announce_date",
263            order_direction="asc"
264        )
265        ```
266    """
267    start_time = time.time()
268    try:
269        # Initialize the model
270        model = AcquisitionModel()
271        await model.initialize()
272
273        # Convert string UUIDs to UUID objects if provided
274        acquisition_uuid_obj: Optional[UUID] = None
275        if acquisition_uuid is not None:
276            acquisition_uuid_obj = UUID(acquisition_uuid)
277
278        acquiree_uuid_obj: Optional[UUID] = None
279        if acquiree_uuid is not None:
280            acquiree_uuid_obj = UUID(acquiree_uuid)
281
282        acquirer_uuid_obj: Optional[UUID] = None
283        if acquirer_uuid is not None:
284            acquirer_uuid_obj = UUID(acquirer_uuid)
285
286        # Convert date strings to datetime objects if provided
287        announce_date_obj: Optional[datetime] = None
288        if acquisition_announce_date is not None:
289            announce_date_obj = datetime.fromisoformat(acquisition_announce_date)
290
291        announce_date_from_obj: Optional[datetime] = None
292        if acquisition_announce_date_from is not None:
293            announce_date_from_obj = datetime.fromisoformat(acquisition_announce_date_from)
294
295        announce_date_to_obj: Optional[datetime] = None
296        if acquisition_announce_date_to is not None:
297            announce_date_to_obj = datetime.fromisoformat(acquisition_announce_date_to)
298
299        # Query the model
300        acquisitions = await model.get(
301            acquisition_uuid=acquisition_uuid_obj,
302            acquiree_uuid=acquiree_uuid_obj,
303            acquirer_uuid=acquirer_uuid_obj,
304            acquisition_type=acquisition_type,
305            acquisition_announce_date=announce_date_obj,
306            acquisition_announce_date_from=announce_date_from_obj,
307            acquisition_announce_date_to=announce_date_to_obj,
308            acquisition_price_usd=acquisition_price_usd,
309            acquisition_price_usd_min=acquisition_price_usd_min,
310            acquisition_price_usd_max=acquisition_price_usd_max,
311            terms=terms,
312            terms_ilike=terms_ilike,
313            acquirer_type=acquirer_type,
314            limit=limit,
315            offset=offset,
316            include_organizations=include_organizations,
317            order_by=(
318                cast(
319                    Optional[Literal["acquisition_announce_date", "acquisition_price_usd"]],
320                    order_by,
321                )
322                if isinstance(order_by, str)
323                and order_by in ("acquisition_announce_date", "acquisition_price_usd")
324                else None
325            ),
326            order_direction=(
327                cast(Optional[Literal["asc", "desc"]], order_direction)
328                if isinstance(order_direction, str) and order_direction in ("asc", "desc")
329                else None
330            ),
331        )
332
333        # Convert Pydantic models to dictionaries
334        result = [acquisition.model_dump() for acquisition in acquisitions]
335        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
336        logger.debug(f"Retrieved {len(result)} acquisition(s) in {execution_time_ms:.2f}ms")
337
338        # Return ToolOutput with successful result
339        return create_tool_output(
340            tool_name="get_acquisitions",
341            success=True,
342            result=result,
343            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
344            metadata={"num_results": len(result)},
345        )
346
347    except Exception as e:
348        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
349        error_msg = f"Failed to get acquisitions: {e}"
350        logger.error(error_msg, exc_info=True)
351
352        # Return ToolOutput with error information
353        return create_tool_output(
354            tool_name="get_acquisitions",
355            success=False,
356            error=error_msg,
357            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
358            metadata={"exception_type": type(e).__name__},
359        )

Get the ToolMetadata for the get_acquisitions tool.

Returns: ToolMetadata object describing this tool's capabilities and parameters.

@observe(as_type='tool')

198@observe(as_type="tool")
199async def get_funding_rounds(
200    funding_round_uuid: Optional[str] = None,
201    investment_date: Optional[str] = None,
202    investment_date_from: Optional[str] = None,
203    investment_date_to: Optional[str] = None,
204    org_uuid: Optional[str] = None,
205    org_name_ilike: Optional[str] = None,
206    general_funding_stage: Optional[str] = None,
207    stage: Optional[str] = None,
208    investors_contains: Optional[str] = None,
209    lead_investors_contains: Optional[str] = None,
210    investor_name_contains: Optional[str] = None,

213    fundraise_amount_usd_min: Optional[int] = None,
214    fundraise_amount_usd_max: Optional[int] = None,
215    valuation_usd: Optional[int] = None,

218    limit: Optional[int] = None,

220    include_organizations: bool = False,
221    order_by: Optional[str] = None,
222    order_direction: Optional[str] = None,
223) -> ToolOutput:
224    """Get funding rounds matching the specified filters.
225
226    This tool queries the fundingrounds table using the FundingRoundModel
227    and returns a list of funding round records as dictionaries.
228
229    Args:
230        funding_round_uuid: Exact match for funding round UUID (as string).
231        investment_date: Exact match for investment date (ISO format string).
232        investment_date_from: Filter funding rounds on or after this date (ISO format string).
233        investment_date_to: Filter funding rounds on or before this date (ISO format string).
234        org_uuid: Exact match for organization UUID (as string).
235        org_name_ilike: Search by organization name (case-insensitive partial match).
236            This performs a JOIN to the organizations table to match by name.
237            Can be combined with org_uuid filter.
238        general_funding_stage: Exact match for general funding stage.
239        stage: Exact match for specific funding stage.
240        investors_contains: Check if investors array contains this UUID (as string).
241            Note: This expects a UUID, not an investor name. Use investor_name_contains for name-based search.
242        lead_investors_contains: Check if lead_investors array contains this UUID (as string).
243            Note: This expects a UUID, not an investor name. Use lead_investor_name_contains for name-based search.
244        investor_name_contains: Search investors by organization name (case-insensitive partial match).
245            This performs a JOIN to the organizations table to match by name.
246        lead_investor_name_contains: Search lead_investors by organization name (case-insensitive partial match).
247            This performs a JOIN to the organizations table to match by name.
248        fundraise_amount_usd: Exact match for fundraise amount in USD.
249        fundraise_amount_usd_min: Filter funding rounds with amount >= this value.
250        fundraise_amount_usd_max: Filter funding rounds with amount <= this value.
251        valuation_usd: Exact match for valuation in USD.
252        valuation_usd_min: Filter funding rounds with valuation >= this value.
253        valuation_usd_max: Filter funding rounds with valuation <= this value.
254        limit: Maximum number of results to return.
255        offset: Number of results to skip (for pagination).
256        include_organizations: If True, includes nested organization details for org_uuid,
257            investors, and lead_investors. Returns FundingRoundWithOrganizations objects
258            with full organization data instead of just UUIDs.
259        order_by: Field to order results by. Must be one of: "investment_date",
260            "fundraise_amount_usd", "valuation_usd". Defaults to "investment_date" if not specified.
261        order_direction: Direction to order results. Must be "asc" or "desc".
262            Defaults to "desc" if not specified.
263
264    Returns:
265        ToolOutput object containing:
266        - success: Whether the query succeeded
267        - result: List of funding round records as dictionaries (if successful).
268            Each dictionary contains all fields from the FundingRound model.
269            If include_organizations=True, also includes:
270            - organization: Full Organization object for the company receiving funding
271            - investors_organizations: List of Organization objects for all investors
272            - lead_investors_organizations: List of Organization objects for lead investors
273        - error: Error message (if failed)
274        - execution_time_ms: Time taken to execute the query
275        - metadata: Additional metadata about the execution
276
277    Example:
278        ```python
279        # Get all funding rounds
280        rounds = await get_funding_rounds()
281
282        # Get by UUID
283        round = await get_funding_rounds(funding_round_uuid="123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000")
284
285        # Get funding rounds by organization name
286        org_rounds = await get_funding_rounds(org_name_ilike="TechCorp")
287
288        # Get funding rounds with amount >= 1M USD
289        large_rounds = await get_funding_rounds(fundraise_amount_usd_min=1000000)
290
291        # Get funding rounds in a date range
292        recent = await get_funding_rounds(
293            investment_date_from="2020-01-01T00:00:00",
294            investment_date_to="2023-12-31T23:59:59"
295        )
296
297        # Get rounds with specific investor by name
298        investor_rounds = await get_funding_rounds(investor_name_contains="Sequoia Capital")
299
300        # Get rounds with specific investor by UUID
301        investor_rounds_by_uuid = await get_funding_rounds(investors_contains="123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000")
302
303        # Get rounds with full organization details
304        rounds_with_orgs = await get_funding_rounds(
305            org_uuid="123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
306            include_organizations=True
307        )
308
309        # Get rounds ordered by fundraise amount (descending)
310        large_rounds = await get_funding_rounds(
311            fundraise_amount_usd_min=1000000,
312            order_by="fundraise_amount_usd",
313            order_direction="desc"
314        )
315
316        # Get rounds ordered by investment date (ascending)
317        oldest_first = await get_funding_rounds(
318            order_by="investment_date",
319            order_direction="asc"
320        )
321        ```
322    """
323    start_time = time.time()
324    try:
325        # Initialize the model
326        model = FundingRoundModel()
327        await model.initialize()
328
329        # Convert string UUIDs to UUID objects if provided
330        funding_round_uuid_obj: Optional[UUID] = None
331        if funding_round_uuid is not None:
332            try:
333                funding_round_uuid_obj = UUID(funding_round_uuid)
334            except (ValueError, TypeError) as e:
335                error_msg = f"Invalid funding_round_uuid format: {funding_round_uuid}. Expected a valid UUID string."
336                logger.error(error_msg)
337                execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
338                return create_tool_output(
339                    tool_name="get_funding_rounds",
340                    success=False,
341                    error=error_msg,
342                    execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
343                    metadata={"exception_type": type(e).__name__},
344                )
345
346        org_uuid_obj: Optional[UUID] = None
347        if org_uuid is not None:
348            try:
349                org_uuid_obj = UUID(org_uuid)
350            except (ValueError, TypeError) as e:
351                error_msg = f"Invalid org_uuid format: {org_uuid}. Expected a valid UUID string."
352                logger.error(error_msg)
353                execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
354                return create_tool_output(
355                    tool_name="get_funding_rounds",
356                    success=False,
357                    error=error_msg,
358                    execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
359                    metadata={"exception_type": type(e).__name__},
360                )
361
362        # Convert date strings to datetime objects if provided
363        investment_date_obj: Optional[datetime] = None
364        if investment_date is not None:
365            investment_date_obj = datetime.fromisoformat(investment_date)
366
367        investment_date_from_obj: Optional[datetime] = None
368        if investment_date_from is not None:
369            investment_date_from_obj = datetime.fromisoformat(investment_date_from)
370
371        investment_date_to_obj: Optional[datetime] = None
372        if investment_date_to is not None:
373            investment_date_to_obj = datetime.fromisoformat(investment_date_to)
374
375        # Query the model
376        funding_rounds = await model.get(
377            funding_round_uuid=funding_round_uuid_obj,
378            investment_date=investment_date_obj,
379            investment_date_from=investment_date_from_obj,
380            investment_date_to=investment_date_to_obj,
381            org_uuid=org_uuid_obj,
382            org_name_ilike=org_name_ilike,
383            general_funding_stage=general_funding_stage,
384            stage=stage,
385            investors_contains=investors_contains,
386            lead_investors_contains=lead_investors_contains,
387            investor_name_contains=investor_name_contains,
388            lead_investor_name_contains=lead_investor_name_contains,
389            fundraise_amount_usd=fundraise_amount_usd,
390            fundraise_amount_usd_min=fundraise_amount_usd_min,
391            fundraise_amount_usd_max=fundraise_amount_usd_max,
392            valuation_usd=valuation_usd,
393            valuation_usd_min=valuation_usd_min,
394            valuation_usd_max=valuation_usd_max,
395            limit=limit,
396            offset=offset,
397            include_organizations=include_organizations,
398            order_by=(
399                cast(
400                    Optional[Literal["investment_date", "fundraise_amount_usd", "valuation_usd"]],
401                    order_by,
402                )
403                if isinstance(order_by, str)
404                and order_by in ("investment_date", "fundraise_amount_usd", "valuation_usd")
405                else None
406            ),
407            order_direction=(
408                cast(Optional[Literal["asc", "desc"]], order_direction)
409                if isinstance(order_direction, str) and order_direction in ("asc", "desc")
410                else None
411            ),
412        )
413
414        # Convert Pydantic models to dictionaries
415        result = [funding_round.model_dump() for funding_round in funding_rounds]
416        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
417        logger.debug(f"Retrieved {len(result)} funding round(s) in {execution_time_ms:.2f}ms")
418
419        # Return ToolOutput with successful result
420        return create_tool_output(
421            tool_name="get_funding_rounds",
422            success=True,
423            result=result,
424            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
425            metadata={"num_results": len(result)},
426        )
427
428    except Exception as e:
429        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
430        error_msg = f"Failed to get funding rounds: {e}"
431        logger.error(error_msg, exc_info=True)
432
433        # Return ToolOutput with error information
434        return create_tool_output(
435            tool_name="get_funding_rounds",
436            success=False,
437            error=error_msg,
438            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
439            metadata={"exception_type": type(e).__name__},
440        )

This tool queries the fundingrounds table using the FundingRoundModel and returns a list of funding round records as dictionaries.

Args: funding_round_uuid: Exact match for funding round UUID (as string). investment_date: Exact match for investment date (ISO format string). investment_date_from: Filter funding rounds on or after this date (ISO format string). investment_date_to: Filter funding rounds on or before this date (ISO format string). org_uuid: Exact match for organization UUID (as string). org_name_ilike: Search by organization name (case-insensitive partial match). @observe(as_type='tool')
async def semantic_search_organizations( text: str, org_uuid: Optional[str] = None, name: Optional[str] = None, categories_contains: Optional[str] = None, org_status: Optional[str] = None, total_funding_usd_min: Optional[float] = None, total_funding_usd_max: Optional[float] = None, founding_date_from: Optional[str] = None, founding_date_to: Optional[str] = None, last_fundraise_date_from: Optional[str] = None, last_fundraise_date_to: Optional[str] = None, employee_count: Optional[str] = None, org_type: Optional[str] = None, stage: Optional[str] = None, valuation_usd_min: Optional[float] = None, valuation_usd_max: Optional[float] = None, investors_contains: Optional[str] = None, general_funding_stage: Optional[str] = None, num_acquisitions_min: Optional[int] = None, num_acquisitions_max: Optional[int] = None, revenue_range: Optional[str] = None, top_k: int = 10, index_name: Optional[str] = None) -> src.contracts.tool_io.ToolOutput: 
205@observe(as_type="tool")
206async def semantic_search_organizations(
207    text: str,
208    org_uuid: Optional[str] = None,
209    name: Optional[str] = None,
210    categories_contains: Optional[str] = None,
211    org_status: Optional[str] = None,
212    total_funding_usd_min: Optional[float] = None,
213    total_funding_usd_max: Optional[float] = None,
214    founding_date_from: Optional[str] = None,
215    founding_date_to: Optional[str] = None,
216    last_fundraise_date_from: Optional[str] = None,
217    last_fundraise_date_to: Optional[str] = None,
218    employee_count: Optional[str] = None,
219    org_type: Optional[str] = None,
220    stage: Optional[str] = None,
221    valuation_usd_min: Optional[float] = None,
222    valuation_usd_max: Optional[float] = None,
223    investors_contains: Optional[str] = None,
224    general_funding_stage: Optional[str] = None,
225    num_acquisitions_min: Optional[int] = None,
226    num_acquisitions_max: Optional[int] = None,
227    revenue_range: Optional[str] = None,
228    top_k: int = 10,
229    index_name: Optional[str] = None,
230) -> ToolOutput:
231    """Semantically search organizations in Pinecone by sector/industry name.
232
233    This tool is designed to query the Pinecone vector database by sector or industry
234    name. The database clusters companies in the same/similar industries together,
235    so queries should specify a sector/industry (e.g., "AI companies", "healthcare
236    startups", "fintech") rather than specific company names. The text will be
237    embedded using text-embedding-3-large and used for semantic similarity search
238    to find companies that closely match that sector/industry.
239
240    Args:
241        text: Sector or industry name to search for (required). Examples: "AI companies",
242            "healthcare startups", "fintech", "closed-source LLM providers". This will
243            be embedded using text-embedding-3-large and used for semantic similarity search.
244        org_uuid: Exact match for organization UUID (as string).
245        name: Exact match for organization name.
246        categories_contains: Check if categories array contains this value.
247        org_status: Exact match for organization status (operating, closed,
248            was_acquired, or ipo).
249        total_funding_usd_min: Filter with total_funding_usd >= this value.
250        total_funding_usd_max: Filter with total_funding_usd <= this value.
251        founding_date_from: Filter organizations founded on or after this date (ISO format string).
252        founding_date_to: Filter organizations founded on or before this date (ISO format string).
253        last_fundraise_date_from: Filter with last_fundraise_date >= this date (ISO format string).
254        last_fundraise_date_to: Filter with last_fundraise_date <= this date (ISO format string).
255        employee_count: Exact match for employee count range.
256        org_type: Exact match for organization type (investor or company).
257        stage: Exact match for funding stage.
258        valuation_usd_min: Filter with valuation_usd >= this value.
259        valuation_usd_max: Filter with valuation_usd <= this value.
260        investors_contains: Check if investors array contains this UUID (as string).
261        general_funding_stage: Exact match for general funding stage.
262        num_acquisitions_min: Filter with num_acquisitions >= this value.
263        num_acquisitions_max: Filter with num_acquisitions <= this value.
264        revenue_range: Exact match for revenue range.
265        top_k: Number of results to return (default: 10).
266        index_name: Name of the Pinecone index to query. If not provided,
267            uses the default index from settings.
268
269    Returns:
270        ToolOutput object containing:
271        - success: Whether the query succeeded
272        - result: List of organization records as dictionaries (if successful).
273            Each dictionary contains all fields from the PineconeOrganization model,
274            including a 'score' field indicating the similarity score from Pinecone.
275        - error: Error message (if failed)
276        - execution_time_ms: Time taken to execute the query
277        - metadata: Additional metadata about the execution
278
279    Example:
280        ```python
281        # Query by sector name
282        orgs = await semantic_search_organizations(
283            text="AI companies",
284            top_k=10
285        )
286
287        # Query by sector with metadata filters
288        orgs = await semantic_search_organizations(
289            text="healthcare startups",
290            org_status="operating",
291            total_funding_usd_min=1000000,
292            general_funding_stage="late_stage_venture",
293            top_k=5
294        )
295
296        # Query by industry with date range
297        orgs = await semantic_search_organizations(
298            text="fintech",
299            founding_date_from="2020-01-01T00:00:00",
300            founding_date_to="2023-12-31T23:59:59",
301            top_k=20
302        )
303
304        # Query by specific sector description
305        orgs = await semantic_search_organizations(
306            text="closed-source LLM providers",
307            top_k=10
308        )
309        ```
310    """
311    start_time = time.time()
312    try:
313        # Initialize the model
314        model = PineconeOrganizationModel()
315        await model.initialize()
316
317        # Convert string UUIDs to UUID objects if provided
318        org_uuid_obj: Optional[UUID] = None
319        if org_uuid is not None:
320            org_uuid_obj = UUID(org_uuid)
321
322        investors_contains_obj: Optional[UUID] = None
323        if investors_contains is not None:
324            investors_contains_obj = UUID(investors_contains)
325
326        # Convert date strings to datetime objects if provided
327        founding_date_from_obj: Optional[datetime] = None
328        if founding_date_from is not None:
329            founding_date_from_obj = datetime.fromisoformat(founding_date_from)
330
331        founding_date_to_obj: Optional[datetime] = None
332        if founding_date_to is not None:
333            founding_date_to_obj = datetime.fromisoformat(founding_date_to)
334
335        last_fundraise_date_from_obj: Optional[datetime] = None
336        if last_fundraise_date_from is not None:
337            last_fundraise_date_from_obj = datetime.fromisoformat(last_fundraise_date_from)
338
339        last_fundraise_date_to_obj: Optional[datetime] = None
340        if last_fundraise_date_to is not None:
341            last_fundraise_date_to_obj = datetime.fromisoformat(last_fundraise_date_to)
342
343        # Query the model
344        organizations = await model.query(
345            text=text,
346            org_uuid=org_uuid_obj,
347            name=name,
348            categories_contains=categories_contains,
349            org_status=org_status,
350            total_funding_usd_min=total_funding_usd_min,
351            total_funding_usd_max=total_funding_usd_max,
352            founding_date_from=founding_date_from_obj,
353            founding_date_to=founding_date_to_obj,
354            last_fundraise_date_from=last_fundraise_date_from_obj,
355            last_fundraise_date_to=last_fundraise_date_to_obj,
356            employee_count=employee_count,
357            org_type=org_type,
358            stage=stage,
359            valuation_usd_min=valuation_usd_min,
360            valuation_usd_max=valuation_usd_max,
361            investors_contains=investors_contains_obj,
362            general_funding_stage=general_funding_stage,
363            num_acquisitions_min=num_acquisitions_min,
364            num_acquisitions_max=num_acquisitions_max,
365            revenue_range=revenue_range,
366            top_k=top_k,
367            index_name=index_name,
368        )
369
370        # Convert Pydantic models to dictionaries
371        result = [org.model_dump() for org in organizations]
372        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
373        logger.debug(
374            f"Retrieved {len(result)} organization(s) from semantic search in {execution_time_ms:.2f}ms"
375        )
376
377        # Return ToolOutput with successful result
378        return create_tool_output(
379            tool_name="semantic_search_organizations",
380            success=True,
381            result=result,
382            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
383            metadata={"num_results": len(result), "top_k": top_k},
384        )
385
386    except Exception as e:
387        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
388        error_msg = f"Failed to semantically search organizations: {e}"
389        logger.error(error_msg, exc_info=True)
390
391        # Return ToolOutput with error information
392        return create_tool_output(
393            tool_name="semantic_search_organizations",
394            success=False,
395            error=error_msg,
396            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
397            metadata={"exception_type": type(e).__name__},
398        )

Semantically search organizations in Pinecone by sector/industry name.

This tool is designed to query the Pinecone vector database by sector or industry name. The database clusters companies in the same/similar industries together, so queries should specify a sector/industry (e.g., "AI companies", "healthcare startups", "fintech") rather than specific company names. The text will be embedded using text-embedding-3-large and used for semantic similarity search to find companies that closely match that sector/industry.

Args: text: Sector or industry name to search for (required). Examples: "AI companies", "healthcare startups", "fintech", "closed-source LLM providers". This will be embedded using text-embedding-3-large and used for semantic similarity search. org_uuid: Exact match for organization UUID (as string). name: Exact match for organization name. categories_contains: Check if categories array contains this value. org_status: Exact match for organization status (operating, closed, was_acquired, or ipo). total_funding_usd_min: Filter with total_funding_usd >= this value. total_funding_usd_max: Filter with total_funding_usd <= this value. founding_date_from: Filter organizations founded on or after this date (ISO format string). founding_date_to: Filter organizations founded on or before this date (ISO format string). last_fundraise_date_from: Filter with last_fundraise_date >= this date (ISO format string). last_fundraise_date_to: Filter with last_fundraise_date <= this date (ISO format string). employee_count: Exact match for employee count range. org_type: Exact match for organization type (investor or company). stage: Exact match for funding stage. valuation_usd_min: Filter with valuation_usd >= this value. valuation_usd_max: Filter with valuation_usd <= this value. investors_contains: Check if investors array contains this UUID (as string). general_funding_stage: Exact match for general funding stage. num_acquisitions_min: Filter with num_acquisitions >= this value. num_acquisitions_max: Filter with num_acquisitions <= this value. revenue_range: Exact match for revenue range. top_k: Number of results to return (default: 10). index_name: Name of the Pinecone index to query. If not provided, uses the default index from settings.

Returns: ToolOutput object containing: - success: Whether the query succeeded - result: List of organization records as dictionaries (if successful). Each dictionary contains all fields from the PineconeOrganization model, including a 'score' field indicating the similarity score from Pinecone. - error: Error message (if failed) - execution_time_ms: Time taken to execute the query - metadata: Additional metadata about the execution

Example:



# Query by sector name
orgs = await semantic_search_organizations(
    text="AI companies",
    top_k=10
)

# Query by sector with metadata filters
orgs = await semantic_search_organizations(
    text="healthcare startups",
    org_status="operating",
    total_funding_usd_min=1000000,
    general_funding_stage="late_stage_venture",
    top_k=5
)

# Query by industry with date range
orgs = await semantic_search_organizations(
    text="fintech",
    founding_date_from="2020-01-01T00:00:00",
    founding_date_to="2023-12-31T23:59:59",
    top_k=20
)

# Query by specific sector description
orgs = await semantic_search_organizations(
    text="closed-source LLM providers",
    top_k=10
)
