 72        returns={
 73            "type": "object",
 74            "description": "Sector concentration analysis results",
 75            "properties": {
 76                "sectors": {
 77                    "type": "array",
 78                    "items": {
 79                        "type": "object",
 80                        "properties": {
 81                            "sector": {"type": "string"},
 82                            "company_count": {"type": "integer"},
 83                            "percentage": {"type": "number"},
 84                            "total_investment_usd": {
 85                                "type": "integer",
 86                                "nullable": True,
 87                            },
 88                            "exit_rate_pct": {"type": "number", "nullable": True},
 89                        },
 90                    },
 91                },
 92                "concentration_index": {
 93                    "type": "number",
 94                    "description": "Herfindahl index (0-1) measuring concentration. Higher values indicate more concentration.",
 95                },
 96                "uncategorized_companies": {
 97                    "type": "integer",
 98                    "description": "Number of companies that couldn't be categorized into any sector",
 99                },
100            },
101        },
102        cost_per_call=None,  # Database queries and computation, minimal cost
103        estimated_latency_ms=500.0,  # Database queries for portfolio companies
104        timeout_seconds=60.0,
105        side_effects=False,  # Read-only operation
106        idempotent=True,  # Safe to retry
107        tags=["analysis", "portfolio", "sector", "concentration", "read-only"],
108    )

Get the ToolMetadata for the analyze_sector_concentration tool.

@observe(as_type='tool')
async def compare_to_market_benchmarks( portfolio_metrics: Dict[str, Any], time_period_start: Optional[str] = None, time_period_end: Optional[str] = None) -> src.contracts.tool_io.ToolOutput: 
117@observe(as_type="tool")
118async def compare_to_market_benchmarks(
119    portfolio_metrics: Dict[str, Any],
120    time_period_start: Optional[str] = None,
121    time_period_end: Optional[str] = None,
122) -> ToolOutput:
123    """Compare portfolio metrics to market benchmarks.
124
125    This tool:
126    1. Queries the database for all companies/investments in the time period
127    2. Calculates market averages for exit rates, ROI, time to exit, round sizes
128    3. Compares portfolio metrics to market averages
129    4. Returns relative performance indicators
130
131    Args:
132        portfolio_metrics: Dictionary from calculate_portfolio_metrics containing:
133            - portfolio_summary: Summary statistics
134            - performance_metrics: ROI and exit metrics
135            - deployment_patterns: Investment deployment patterns
136        time_period_start: Start date for market benchmark calculation (ISO format string).
137        time_period_end: End date for market benchmark calculation (ISO format string).
138
139    Returns:
140        ToolOutput object containing:
141        - success: Whether the comparison succeeded
142        - result: Dictionary with:
143            - market_benchmarks: Market average metrics
144            - portfolio_metrics: Portfolio metrics (from input)
145            - comparison: Relative performance comparison (e.g., "+5.2%", "-180 days")
146            - relative_performance: Percentile scores
147        - error: Error message (if failed)
148        - execution_time_ms: Time taken to execute
149        - metadata: Additional metadata about the execution
150
151    Example:
152        ```python
153        # Compare portfolio to market
154        portfolio_metrics = {
155            "portfolio_summary": {"exit_rate_pct": 26.7, ...},
156            "performance_metrics": {"average_roi_estimate": 3.2, ...},
157            ...
158        }
159        result = await compare_to_market_benchmarks(
160            portfolio_metrics=portfolio_metrics,
161            time_period_start="2018-01-01T00:00:00",
162            time_period_end="2024-12-31T23:59:59"
163        )
164        ```
165    """
166    start_time = time.time()
167    try:
168        # Validate inputs
169        if not portfolio_metrics:
170            raise ValueError("portfolio_metrics cannot be empty")
171
172        portfolio_summary = portfolio_metrics.get("portfolio_summary", {})
173        performance_metrics = portfolio_metrics.get("performance_metrics", {})
174        deployment_patterns = portfolio_metrics.get("deployment_patterns", {})
175
176        # Parse dates if provided
177        period_start = None
178        period_end = None
179        if time_period_start:
180            normalized_start = (
181                time_period_start.replace("Z", "+00:00")
182                if time_period_start.endswith("Z")
183                else time_period_start
184            )
185            period_start = datetime.fromisoformat(normalized_start)
186            if period_start.tzinfo is not None:
187                period_start = period_start.astimezone(timezone.utc).replace(tzinfo=None)
188        if time_period_end:
189            normalized_end = (
190                time_period_end.replace("Z", "+00:00")
191                if time_period_end.endswith("Z")
192                else time_period_end
193            )
194            period_end = datetime.fromisoformat(normalized_end)
195            if period_end.tzinfo is not None:
196                period_end = period_end.astimezone(timezone.utc).replace(tzinfo=None)
197
198        if period_start and period_end and period_start >= period_end:
199            raise ValueError(
200                f"time_period_start ({time_period_start}) must be before time_period_end ({time_period_end})"
201            )
202
203        logger.info("Calculating market benchmarks from database")
204
205        # Initialize models
206        funding_model = FundingRoundModel()
207        await funding_model.initialize()
208
209        acquisition_model = AcquisitionModel()
210        await acquisition_model.initialize()
211
212        org_model = OrganizationModel()
213        await org_model.initialize()
214
215        # Calculate market benchmarks
216        # 1. Market exit rate: percentage of all companies that were acquired
217        logger.info("Calculating market exit rate")
218        all_orgs = await org_model.get()
219        all_org_uuids = {org.org_uuid for org in all_orgs if org.org_uuid}
220
221        # Filter by time period if provided (companies founded in period)
222        if period_start or period_end:
223            filtered_orgs = []
224            for org in all_orgs:
225                if org.founding_date:
226                    if period_start and org.founding_date < period_start:
227                        continue
228                    if period_end and org.founding_date > period_end:
229                        continue
230                filtered_orgs.append(org)
231            all_org_uuids = {org.org_uuid for org in filtered_orgs if org.org_uuid}
232
233        # Get all acquisitions
234        all_acquisitions = await acquisition_model.get(
235            acquisition_announce_date_from=period_start,
236            acquisition_announce_date_to=period_end,
237        )
238
239        # Filter acquisitions to those in our org set
240        acquired_org_uuids = {
241            acq.acquiree_uuid
242            for acq in all_acquisitions
243            if acq.acquiree_uuid and acq.acquiree_uuid in all_org_uuids
244        }
245
246        market_exit_rate_pct = (
247            (len(acquired_org_uuids) / len(all_org_uuids) * 100) if all_org_uuids else None
248        )
249
250        # 2. Market time to exit: average time from first funding to acquisition
251        # 3. Market ROI: average ROI from acquisitions
252        # Optimize: Fetch all funding rounds for acquired companies in batch instead of N+1 queries
253        logger.info("Calculating market time to exit and ROI")
254
255        # Get all unique org UUIDs from acquisitions
256        acquired_org_uuids_list = [
257            acq.acquiree_uuid for acq in all_acquisitions if acq.acquiree_uuid
258        ]
259
260        # Build lookup dictionary: org_uuid -> list of funding rounds
261        funding_rounds_by_org: Dict[UUID, List[FundingRound]] = {}
262
263        if acquired_org_uuids_list:
264            # Fetch all funding rounds for acquired companies in batch
265            # Note: We need ALL rounds (not filtered by date) to calculate first funding date and total funding
266            all_funding_rounds = await funding_model.get(
267                org_uuids=acquired_org_uuids_list,
268            )
269
270            # Group by org_uuid
271            for round_obj in all_funding_rounds:
272                if round_obj.org_uuid:
273                    if round_obj.org_uuid not in funding_rounds_by_org:
274                        funding_rounds_by_org[round_obj.org_uuid] = []
275                    funding_rounds_by_org[round_obj.org_uuid].append(round_obj)
276
277            # Sort rounds by investment_date for each org
278            for org_uuid in funding_rounds_by_org:
279                funding_rounds_by_org[org_uuid].sort(
280                    key=lambda r: r.investment_date or datetime.min.replace(tzinfo=None)
281                )
282
283        # Calculate time to exit and ROI using in-memory lookups
284        market_times_to_exit = []
285        market_roi_estimates = []
286
287        for acquisition in all_acquisitions:
288            if not acquisition.acquiree_uuid:
289                continue
290
291            company_rounds = funding_rounds_by_org.get(acquisition.acquiree_uuid, [])
292
293            # Calculate time to exit (if we have rounds and acquisition date)
294            if (
295                company_rounds
296                and company_rounds[0].investment_date
297                and acquisition.acquisition_announce_date
298            ):
299                first_funding_date = company_rounds[0].investment_date
300                delta = acquisition.acquisition_announce_date - first_funding_date
301                if delta.days >= 0:
302                    market_times_to_exit.append(delta.days)
303
304            # Calculate ROI (if we have acquisition price and funding)
305            if acquisition.acquisition_price_usd and company_rounds:
306                total_funding = sum(
307                    r.fundraise_amount_usd for r in company_rounds if r.fundraise_amount_usd
308                )
309
310                if total_funding > 0:
311                    roi = acquisition.acquisition_price_usd / total_funding
312                    market_roi_estimates.append(roi)
313
314        market_avg_time_to_exit_days = (
315            round(statistics.mean(market_times_to_exit), 1) if market_times_to_exit else None
316        )
317
318        market_avg_roi = (
319            round(statistics.mean(market_roi_estimates), 2) if market_roi_estimates else None
320        )
321        market_median_roi = (
322            round(statistics.median(market_roi_estimates), 2) if market_roi_estimates else None
323        )
324
325        # 4. Market round sizes: average round sizes from all funding rounds
326        logger.info("Calculating market round sizes")
327        all_market_rounds = await funding_model.get(
328            investment_date_from=period_start,
329            investment_date_to=period_end,
330        )
331
332        market_round_sizes = [
333            r.fundraise_amount_usd for r in all_market_rounds if r.fundraise_amount_usd
334        ]
335
336        market_avg_round_size = (
337            round(statistics.mean(market_round_sizes)) if market_round_sizes else None
338        )
339        market_median_round_size = (
340            round(statistics.median(market_round_sizes)) if market_round_sizes else None
341        )
342
343        # Build market benchmarks
344        market_benchmarks = {
345            "exit_rate_pct": (
346                round(market_exit_rate_pct, 1) if market_exit_rate_pct is not None else None
347            ),
348            "average_time_to_exit_days": market_avg_time_to_exit_days,
349            "average_roi_estimate": market_avg_roi,
350            "median_roi_estimate": market_median_roi,
351            "average_round_size_usd": market_avg_round_size,
352            "median_round_size_usd": market_median_round_size,
353        }
354
355        # Compare portfolio to market
356        portfolio_exit_rate = portfolio_summary.get("exit_rate_pct")
357        portfolio_time_to_exit = portfolio_summary.get("average_time_to_exit_days")
358        portfolio_avg_roi = performance_metrics.get("average_roi_estimate")
359        portfolio_avg_round_size = deployment_patterns.get("average_round_size_usd")
360
361        # Calculate relative differences
362        exit_rate_vs_market = None
363        if portfolio_exit_rate is not None and market_exit_rate_pct is not None:
364            diff = portfolio_exit_rate - market_exit_rate_pct
365            exit_rate_vs_market = f"+{diff:.1f}%" if diff >= 0 else f"{diff:.1f}%"
366
367        time_to_exit_vs_market = None
368        if portfolio_time_to_exit is not None and market_avg_time_to_exit_days is not None:
369            diff = portfolio_time_to_exit - market_avg_time_to_exit_days
370            time_to_exit_vs_market = f"+{diff:.0f} days" if diff >= 0 else f"{diff:.0f} days"
371
372        roi_vs_market = None
373        if portfolio_avg_roi is not None and market_avg_roi is not None:
374            diff = portfolio_avg_roi - market_avg_roi
375            roi_vs_market = f"+{diff:.1f}x" if diff >= 0 else f"{diff:.1f}x"
376
377        round_size_vs_market = None
378        if portfolio_avg_round_size is not None and market_avg_round_size is not None:
379            diff_pct = (
380                (portfolio_avg_round_size - market_avg_round_size) / market_avg_round_size * 100
381            )
382            round_size_vs_market = f"+{diff_pct:.1f}%" if diff_pct >= 0 else f"{diff_pct:.1f}%"
383
384        comparison = {
385            "exit_rate_vs_market": exit_rate_vs_market,
386            "time_to_exit_vs_market": time_to_exit_vs_market,
387            "roi_vs_market": roi_vs_market,
388            "round_size_vs_market": round_size_vs_market,
389        }
390
391        # Calculate percentiles (simplified - would need full distribution for accurate percentiles)
392        # For now, we'll provide a basic comparison
393        exit_rate_percentile = None
394        if portfolio_exit_rate is not None and market_exit_rate_pct is not None:
395            # Simple percentile estimate: if portfolio is above market, assume >50th percentile
396            if portfolio_exit_rate > market_exit_rate_pct:
397                exit_rate_percentile = min(
398                    99,
399                    50 + ((portfolio_exit_rate - market_exit_rate_pct) / market_exit_rate_pct * 50),
400                )
401            else:
402                exit_rate_percentile = max(
403                    1,
404                    50 - ((market_exit_rate_pct - portfolio_exit_rate) / market_exit_rate_pct * 50),
405                )
406            exit_rate_percentile = round(exit_rate_percentile, 1)
407
408        roi_percentile = None
409        if portfolio_avg_roi is not None and market_avg_roi is not None:
410            # Simple percentile estimate
411            if portfolio_avg_roi > market_avg_roi:
412                roi_percentile = min(
413                    99,
414                    50 + ((portfolio_avg_roi - market_avg_roi) / market_avg_roi * 50),
415                )
416            else:
417                roi_percentile = max(
418                    1, 50 - ((market_avg_roi - portfolio_avg_roi) / market_avg_roi * 50)
419                )
420            roi_percentile = round(roi_percentile, 1)
421
422        relative_performance = {
423            "exit_rate_percentile": exit_rate_percentile,
424            "roi_percentile": roi_percentile,
425        }
426
427        # Build result
428        result = {
429            "market_benchmarks": market_benchmarks,
430            "portfolio_metrics": portfolio_metrics,
431            "comparison": comparison,
432            "relative_performance": relative_performance,
433        }
434
435        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
436
437        metadata = {
438            "market_companies": len(all_org_uuids),
439            "market_acquisitions": len(acquired_org_uuids),
440            "market_rounds": len(market_round_sizes),
441        }
442
443        logger.debug(f"Compared portfolio to market benchmarks in {execution_time_ms:.2f}ms")
444
445        # Return ToolOutput with successful result
446        return create_tool_output(
447            tool_name="compare_to_market_benchmarks",
448            success=True,
449            result=result,
450            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
451            metadata=metadata,
452        )
453
454    except Exception as e:
455        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
456        error_msg = f"Failed to compare to market benchmarks: {e}"
457        logger.error(error_msg, exc_info=True)
458
459        # Return ToolOutput with error information
460        return create_tool_output(
461            tool_name="compare_to_market_benchmarks",
462            success=False,
463            error=error_msg,
464            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
465            metadata={"exception_type": type(e).__name__},
466        )

Compare portfolio metrics to market benchmarks.

This tool:

  1. Queries the database for all companies/investments in the time period
  2. Calculates market averages for exit rates, ROI, time to exit, round sizes
  3. Compares portfolio metrics to market averages
  4. Returns relative performance indicators

Args: portfolio_metrics: Dictionary from calculate_portfolio_metrics containing: - portfolio_summary: Summary statistics - performance_metrics: ROI and exit metrics - deployment_patterns: Investment deployment patterns time_period_start: Start date for market benchmark calculation (ISO format string). time_period_end: End date for market benchmark calculation (ISO format string).

Returns: ToolOutput object containing: - success: Whether the comparison succeeded - result: Dictionary with: - market_benchmarks: Market average metrics - portfolio_metrics: Portfolio metrics (from input) - comparison: Relative performance comparison (e.g., "+5.2%", "-180 days") - relative_performance: Percentile scores - error: Error message (if failed) - execution_time_ms: Time taken to execute - metadata: Additional metadata about the execution

Example:



# Compare portfolio to market
portfolio_metrics = {
    "portfolio_summary": {"exit_rate_pct": 26.7, ...},
    "performance_metrics": {"average_roi_estimate": 3.2, ...},
    ...
}
result = await compare_to_market_benchmarks(
    portfolio_metrics=portfolio_metrics,
    time_period_start="2018-01-01T00:00:00",
    time_period_end="2024-12-31T23:59:59"
)

@observe(as_type='tool')
async def identify_investment_patterns( portfolio_companies: List[Dict[str, Any]], time_period_start: Optional[str] = None, time_period_end: Optional[str] = None) -> src.contracts.tool_io.ToolOutput: 
125@observe(as_type="tool")
126async def identify_investment_patterns(
127    portfolio_companies: List[Dict[str, Any]],
128    time_period_start: Optional[str] = None,
129    time_period_end: Optional[str] = None,
130    # Note: sector analysis is handled by analyze_sector_concentration tool
131) -> ToolOutput:
132    """Identify investment patterns in an investor's portfolio.
133
134    This tool:
135    1. Analyzes stage preferences from funding rounds
136    2. Calculates investment velocity and timing patterns
137    3. Determines lead investor percentage
138    4. Analyzes round size preferences
139    5. Identifies seasonal/quarterly patterns
140
141    Args:
142        portfolio_companies: List of portfolio company dictionaries from find_investor_portfolio.
143            Each should have 'org_uuid', 'funding_rounds', and optionally company details.
144        time_period_start: Start date for analysis period (ISO format string).
145        time_period_end: End date for analysis period (ISO format string).
146
147    Returns:
148        ToolOutput object containing:
149        - success: Whether the analysis succeeded
150        - result: Dictionary with:
151            - preferred_stages: List of preferred stages
152            - stage_distribution: Stage distribution counts
153            - average_round_size_usd: Average round size
154            - median_round_size_usd: Median round size
155            - lead_investor_pct: Percentage of lead investments
156            - investment_velocity: Velocity description
157            - investments_per_quarter: Quarterly investment counts
158            - peak_quarters: Quarters with highest activity
159            - round_size_preferences: Round size category analysis
160        - error: Error message (if failed)
161        - execution_time_ms: Time taken to execute
162        - metadata: Additional metadata about the execution
163
164    Example:
165        ```python
166        # Identify patterns for a portfolio
167        portfolio = [
168            {
169                "org_uuid": "...",
170                "funding_rounds": [
171                    {
172                        "investment_date": "2023-01-15T00:00:00",
173                        "fundraise_amount_usd": 5000000,
174                        "stage": "Series A",
175                        "was_lead": True
176                    }
177                ]
178            }
179        ]
180        result = await identify_investment_patterns(
181            portfolio_companies=portfolio,
182            time_period_start="2018-01-01T00:00:00",
183            time_period_end="2024-12-31T23:59:59"
184        )
185        ```
186    """
187    start_time = time.time()
188    try:
189        # Validate inputs
190        if not portfolio_companies:
191            raise ValueError("portfolio_companies cannot be empty")
192
193        # Parse dates if provided
194        period_start = None
195        period_end = None
196        if time_period_start:
197            normalized_start = (
198                time_period_start.replace("Z", "+00:00")
199                if time_period_start.endswith("Z")
200                else time_period_start
201            )
202            period_start = datetime.fromisoformat(normalized_start)
203            if period_start.tzinfo is not None:
204                period_start = period_start.astimezone(timezone.utc).replace(tzinfo=None)
205        if time_period_end:
206            normalized_end = (
207                time_period_end.replace("Z", "+00:00")
208                if time_period_end.endswith("Z")
209                else time_period_end
210            )
211            period_end = datetime.fromisoformat(normalized_end)
212            if period_end.tzinfo is not None:
213                period_end = period_end.astimezone(timezone.utc).replace(tzinfo=None)
214
215        if period_start and period_end and period_start >= period_end:
216            raise ValueError(
217                f"time_period_start ({time_period_start}) must be before time_period_end ({time_period_end})"
218            )
219
220        logger.info(
221            f"Identifying investment patterns for {len(portfolio_companies)} portfolio companies"
222        )
223
224        # Collect all funding rounds from portfolio companies
225        all_rounds = []
226        for company in portfolio_companies:
227            funding_rounds = company.get("funding_rounds", [])
228            for round_data in funding_rounds:
229                # Filter by time period if provided
230                if period_start or period_end:
231                    investment_date_str = round_data.get("investment_date")
232                    if investment_date_str:
233                        try:
234                            investment_date = datetime.fromisoformat(
235                                investment_date_str.replace("Z", "+00:00")
236                                if investment_date_str.endswith("Z")
237                                else investment_date_str
238                            )
239                            if investment_date.tzinfo is not None:
240                                investment_date = investment_date.astimezone(timezone.utc).replace(
241                                    tzinfo=None
242                                )
243
244                            if period_start and investment_date < period_start:
245                                continue
246                            if period_end and investment_date > period_end:
247                                continue
248                        except (ValueError, TypeError):
249                            # Skip rounds with invalid dates
250                            continue
251
252                all_rounds.append(round_data)
253
254        if not all_rounds:
255            # Return empty patterns if no rounds found
256            empty_result: Dict[str, Any] = {
257                "preferred_stages": [],
258                "stage_distribution": {},
259                "average_round_size_usd": None,
260                "median_round_size_usd": None,
261                "lead_investor_pct": None,
262                "investment_velocity": None,
263                "investments_per_quarter": [],
264                "peak_quarters": [],
265                "round_size_preferences": {
266                    "small_rounds_pct": None,
267                    "medium_rounds_pct": None,
268                    "large_rounds_pct": None,
269                },
270            }
271
272            execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
273            return create_tool_output(
274                tool_name="identify_investment_patterns",
275                success=True,
276                result=empty_result,
277                execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
278                metadata={"num_rounds": 0},
279            )
280
281        logger.info(f"Analyzing {len(all_rounds)} funding rounds")
282
283        # Analyze stage preferences
284        stage_counter: Counter[str] = Counter()
285        stage_distribution: Dict[str, int] = {}
286        for round_data in all_rounds:
287            stage = round_data.get("stage") or round_data.get("general_funding_stage")
288            if stage:
289                stage_counter[stage] += 1
290
291        # Build stage distribution
292        total_stages = sum(stage_counter.values())
293        for stage, count in stage_counter.items():
294            stage_distribution[stage] = count
295
296        # Get preferred stages (top 5, ordered by frequency)
297        preferred_stages = [stage for stage, _ in stage_counter.most_common(5)]
298
299        # Analyze round sizes
300        round_sizes = [
301            round_data.get("fundraise_amount_usd")
302            for round_data in all_rounds
303            if round_data.get("fundraise_amount_usd") is not None
304        ]
305
306        average_round_size_usd = round(statistics.mean(round_sizes)) if round_sizes else None
307        median_round_size_usd = round(statistics.median(round_sizes)) if round_sizes else None
308
309        # Analyze round size preferences (small/medium/large)
310        # Define thresholds: small < $1M, medium $1M-$10M, large > $10M
311        small_rounds = [s for s in round_sizes if s < 1_000_000]
312        medium_rounds = [s for s in round_sizes if 1_000_000 <= s <= 10_000_000]
313        large_rounds = [s for s in round_sizes if s > 10_000_000]
314
315        total_rounds_with_size = len(round_sizes)
316        small_rounds_pct = (
317            round((len(small_rounds) / total_rounds_with_size * 100), 1)
318            if total_rounds_with_size > 0
319            else None
320        )
321        medium_rounds_pct = (
322            round((len(medium_rounds) / total_rounds_with_size * 100), 1)
323            if total_rounds_with_size > 0
324            else None
325        )
326        large_rounds_pct = (
327            round((len(large_rounds) / total_rounds_with_size * 100), 1)
328            if total_rounds_with_size > 0
329            else None
330        )
331
332        # Analyze lead investor percentage
333        lead_investments = [
334            round_data for round_data in all_rounds if round_data.get("was_lead", False)
335        ]
336        lead_investor_pct = (
337            round((len(lead_investments) / len(all_rounds) * 100), 1) if all_rounds else None
338        )
339
340        # Analyze investment velocity and timing patterns
341        investment_dates = []
342        for round_data in all_rounds:
343            investment_date_str = round_data.get("investment_date")
344            if investment_date_str:
345                try:
346                    investment_date = datetime.fromisoformat(
347                        investment_date_str.replace("Z", "+00:00")
348                        if investment_date_str.endswith("Z")
349                        else investment_date_str
350                    )
351                    if investment_date.tzinfo is not None:
352                        investment_date = investment_date.astimezone(timezone.utc).replace(
353                            tzinfo=None
354                        )
355                    investment_dates.append(investment_date)
356                except (ValueError, TypeError):
357                    continue
358
359        # Calculate investment velocity
360        investment_velocity = None
361        investments_per_quarter = []
362        peak_quarters = []
363
364        if len(investment_dates) >= 2:
365            # Calculate date range
366            min_date = min(investment_dates)
367            max_date = max(investment_dates)
368            date_range_days = (max_date - min_date).days
369
370            if date_range_days > 0:
371                # Calculate investments per year
372                date_range_years = date_range_days / 365.25
373                investments_per_year = len(investment_dates) / date_range_years
374
375                # Format velocity description
376                if investments_per_year < 1:
377                    investment_velocity = (
378                        f"{round(investments_per_year * 12, 1)} investments per year"
379                    )
380                elif investments_per_year < 4:
381                    investments_per_quarter_avg = investments_per_year / 4
382                    investment_velocity = (
383                        f"{round(investments_per_quarter_avg, 1)} investments per quarter"
384                    )
385                else:
386                    investments_per_month_avg = investments_per_year / 12
387                    investment_velocity = (
388                        f"{round(investments_per_month_avg, 1)} investments per month"
389                    )
390
391            # Analyze quarterly patterns
392            if date_range_days >= 90:  # At least 3 months of data
393                # Group investments by quarter
394                quarterly_counts: Dict[str, int] = defaultdict(int)
395                for date in investment_dates:
396                    quarter = f"{date.year}-Q{(date.month - 1) // 3 + 1}"
397                    quarterly_counts[quarter] += 1
398
399                # Sort quarters chronologically
400                sorted_quarters = sorted(quarterly_counts.keys())
401                investments_per_quarter = [quarterly_counts[q] for q in sorted_quarters]
402
403                # Find peak quarters (top 3)
404                if quarterly_counts:
405                    sorted_by_count = sorted(
406                        quarterly_counts.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True
407                    )
408                    peak_quarters = [q for q, _ in sorted_by_count[:3]]
409
410        # Build result
411        result: Dict[str, Any] = {
412            "preferred_stages": preferred_stages,
413            "stage_distribution": stage_distribution,
414            "average_round_size_usd": average_round_size_usd,
415            "median_round_size_usd": median_round_size_usd,
416            "lead_investor_pct": lead_investor_pct,
417            "investment_velocity": investment_velocity,
418            "investments_per_quarter": investments_per_quarter,
419            "peak_quarters": peak_quarters,
420            "round_size_preferences": {
421                "small_rounds_pct": small_rounds_pct,
422                "medium_rounds_pct": medium_rounds_pct,
423                "large_rounds_pct": large_rounds_pct,
424            },
425        }
426
427        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
428
429        metadata = {
430            "num_rounds": len(all_rounds),
431            "num_companies": len(portfolio_companies),
432        }
433
434        logger.debug(
435            f"Identified investment patterns for {len(all_rounds)} rounds "
436            f"in {execution_time_ms:.2f}ms"
437        )
438
439        # Return ToolOutput with successful result
440        return create_tool_output(
441            tool_name="identify_investment_patterns",
442            success=True,
443            result=result,
444            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
445            metadata=metadata,
446        )
447
448    except Exception as e:
449        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
450        error_msg = f"Failed to identify investment patterns: {e}"
451        logger.error(error_msg, exc_info=True)
452
453        # Return ToolOutput with error information
454        return create_tool_output(
455            tool_name="identify_investment_patterns",
456            success=False,
457            error=error_msg,
458            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
459            metadata={"exception_type": type(e).__name__},
460        )

Identify investment patterns in an investor's portfolio.

This tool:

  1. Analyzes stage preferences from funding rounds
  2. Calculates investment velocity and timing patterns
  3. Determines lead investor percentage
  4. Analyzes round size preferences
  5. Identifies seasonal/quarterly patterns

Args: portfolio_companies: List of portfolio company dictionaries from find_investor_portfolio. Each should have 'org_uuid', 'funding_rounds', and optionally company details. time_period_start: Start date for analysis period (ISO format string). time_period_end: End date for analysis period (ISO format string).

Returns: ToolOutput object containing: - success: Whether the analysis succeeded - result: Dictionary with: - preferred_stages: List of preferred stages - stage_distribution: Stage distribution counts - average_round_size_usd: Average round size - median_round_size_usd: Median round size - lead_investor_pct: Percentage of lead investments - investment_velocity: Velocity description - investments_per_quarter: Quarterly investment counts - peak_quarters: Quarters with highest activity - round_size_preferences: Round size category analysis - error: Error message (if failed) - execution_time_ms: Time taken to execute - metadata: Additional metadata about the execution

Example:



# Identify patterns for a portfolio
portfolio = [
    {
        "org_uuid": "...",
        "funding_rounds": [
            {
                "investment_date": "2023-01-15T00:00:00",
                "fundraise_amount_usd": 5000000,
                "stage": "Series A",
                "was_lead": True
            }
        ]
    }
]
result = await identify_investment_patterns(
    portfolio_companies=portfolio,
    time_period_start="2018-01-01T00:00:00",
    time_period_end="2024-12-31T23:59:59"
)

@observe(as_type='tool')
async def web_search( query: str, model: str = 'gpt-4.1-mini', system_prompt: Optional[str] = None, temperature: Optional[float] = None, max_tokens: Optional[int] = None) -> src.contracts.tool_io.ToolOutput: 
100@observe(as_type="tool")
101async def web_search(
102    query: str,
103    model: str = "gpt-4.1-mini",
104    system_prompt: Optional[str] = None,
105    temperature: Optional[float] = None,
106    max_tokens: Optional[int] = None,
107) -> ToolOutput:
108    """Perform a web search using LLM with web search capabilities.
109
110    This tool uses the generate_llm_response function with enable_web_search=True
111    to get additional context and information about a user's query. The LLM will
112    use its built-in web search capabilities to provide enriched context.
113
114    Args:
115        query: The search query or question to get additional context about.
116        model: Model to use for the web search-enabled LLM call (default: "gpt-4.1-mini").
117        system_prompt: Optional system prompt to guide the LLM's response. If not provided,
118            a default prompt will be used that instructs the LLM to provide context
119            relevant to the query.
120        temperature: Sampling temperature (0-2). Higher values make output more random.
121            Not used with o1 models.
122        max_tokens: Maximum tokens to generate in the response.
123
124    Returns:
125        ToolOutput object containing:
126        - success: Whether the web search succeeded
127        - result: Dictionary with:
128            - response: The LLM-generated response with web search context
129            - model: The model used for the search
130        - error: Error message (if failed)
131        - execution_time_ms: Time taken to execute the search
132        - metadata: Additional metadata about the execution
133
134    Example:
135        ```python
136        # Basic web search
137        result = await web_search(query="What are the latest trends in AI funding?")
138
139        # Web search with custom model and system prompt
140        result = await web_search(
141            query="What happened with OpenAI in 2024?",
142            model="gpt-4",
143            system_prompt="Provide a concise summary of recent events.",
144            temperature=0.7
145        )
146
147        # Web search with token limit
148        result = await web_search(
149            query="Explain quantum computing",
150            max_tokens=500
151        )
152        ```
153    """
154    start_time = time.time()
155    try:
156        # Validate query
157        if not query or not query.strip():
158            error_msg = "Query cannot be empty"
159            logger.error(error_msg)
160            execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
161            return create_tool_output(
162                tool_name="web_search",
163                success=False,
164                error=error_msg,
165                execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
166            )
167
168        # Default system prompt if not provided
169        default_system_prompt = (
170            "You are a helpful assistant that uses web search to provide accurate, "
171            "up-to-date information. Use web search to find relevant context about "
172            "the user's query and provide a comprehensive response based on the "
173            "search results. Focus on factual information and cite sources when possible."
174        )
175        effective_system_prompt = system_prompt or default_system_prompt
176
177        # Build the prompt for web search
178        # The prompt should encourage the LLM to use web search to find relevant information
179        search_prompt = (
180            f"Please search the web for information about: {query}\n\n"
181            f"Provide a comprehensive response with relevant context, facts, and "
182            f"up-to-date information related to this query."
183        )
184
185        logger.info(f"Performing web search for query: {query[:100]}")
186
187        # Call generate_llm_response with web search enabled
188        response = await generate_llm_response(
189            prompt=search_prompt,
190            model=model,
191            system_prompt=effective_system_prompt,
192            temperature=temperature,
193            max_tokens=max_tokens,
194            enable_web_search=True,
195            return_text=True,  # Return just the text content
196        )
197
198        # Extract response text
199        response_text = response if isinstance(response, str) else ""
200
201        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
202        logger.debug(
203            f"Web search completed in {execution_time_ms:.2f}ms, "
204            f"response length: {len(response_text)} chars"
205        )
206
207        # Return ToolOutput with successful result
208        return create_tool_output(
209            tool_name="web_search",
210            success=True,
211            result={
212                "response": response_text,
213                "model": model,
214            },
215            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
216            metadata={
217                "response_length": len(response_text),
218                "model_used": model,
219            },
220        )
221
222    except Exception as e:
223        execution_time_ms = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000
224        error_msg = f"Failed to perform web search: {e}"
225        logger.error(error_msg, exc_info=True)
226
227        # Return ToolOutput with error information
228        return create_tool_output(
229            tool_name="web_search",
230            success=False,
231            error=error_msg,
232            execution_time_ms=execution_time_ms,
233            metadata={"exception_type": type(e).__name__},
234        )

Perform a web search using LLM with web search capabilities.

This tool uses the generate_llm_response function with enable_web_search=True to get additional context and information about a user's query. The LLM will use its built-in web search capabilities to provide enriched context.

Args: query: The search query or question to get additional context about. model: Model to use for the web search-enabled LLM call (default: "gpt-4.1-mini"). system_prompt: Optional system prompt to guide the LLM's response. If not provided, a default prompt will be used that instructs the LLM to provide context relevant to the query. temperature: Sampling temperature (0-2). Higher values make output more random. Not used with o1 models. max_tokens: Maximum tokens to generate in the response.

Returns: ToolOutput object containing: - success: Whether the web search succeeded - result: Dictionary with: - response: The LLM-generated response with web search context - model: The model used for the search - error: Error message (if failed) - execution_time_ms: Time taken to execute the search - metadata: Additional metadata about the execution

Example:



# Basic web search

# Web search with custom model and system prompt

    query="What happened with OpenAI in 2024?",
    model="gpt-4",
    system_prompt="Provide a concise summary of recent events.",
    temperature=0.7
)

# Web search with token limit
result = await web_search(
    query="Explain quantum computing",
    max_tokens=500
)

class QueryEnrichmentService: 
 68class QueryEnrichmentService:
 69    """Service for enriching user queries and extracting structured metadata."""
 70
 71    def __init__(self):
 72        """Initialize the query enrichment service."""
 73        self._base_prompt = """You are a query enrichment and metadata extraction assistant. Your job is to:
 74
 751. **Improve the query**: 
 76   - Resolve pronouns (e.g., "it", "they", "that company") using conversation history
 77   - Add missing context from previous messages
 78   - Make the query more specific and clear
 79   - Preserve the original intent and meaning
 80
 812. **Extract structured metadata**:
 82   - Identify company names mentioned (extract as list)
 83   - Identify sector/industry names mentioned
 84   - Identify investor names mentioned (for investor portfolio queries)
 85   - Extract time periods (convert relative terms like "last year" to ISO dates)
 86   - Extract funding amounts (convert mentions like "over $1M" to numeric values)
 87   - Identify funding stages mentioned
 88   - Classify query intent
 89
 90Rules:
 91- Only extract information that is explicitly mentioned or clearly implied
 92- For time periods, convert relative terms to ISO format dates (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS)
 93- For amounts, convert to integers (USD)
 94- Be conservative - only extract what you're confident about
 95- Leave fields as empty/null if not mentioned
 96- Query intent should be one of: find_funding_rounds, find_investor_portfolio, find_acquisitions, find_organizations, analyze_sector_trends"""
 97
 98    async def enrich_query(
 99        self,
100        query: str,
101        conversation_history: Optional[List[Dict[str, str]]] = None,
102    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
103        """Enrich query and extract metadata.
104
105        This method uses a single LLM call to both improve the query text
106        and extract structured metadata. If query improvement succeeds but
107        metadata extraction fails, the improved query is still returned with
108        empty metadata.
109
110        Args:
111            query: The user's query to enrich.
112            conversation_history: Optional list of previous messages in the conversation.
113                Each message should be a dict with 'role' and 'content' keys.
114
115        Returns:
116            Dictionary containing:
117            - improved_query: str - The improved/enriched query
118            - original_query: str - The original query
119            - metadata: Dict - ExtractedQueryMetadata as a dictionary
120
121        Raises:
122            Exception: If enrichment completely fails, returns original query with empty metadata.
123        """
124        if not query or not query.strip():
125            logger.warning("Empty query provided, returning as-is")
126            return {
127                "improved_query": query,
128                "original_query": query,
129                "metadata": ExtractedQueryMetadata(
130                    improved_query=query, original_query=query
131                ).model_dump(),
132            }
133
134        try:
135            # Build function schema that matches ExtractedQueryMetadata
136            extract_metadata_tool = {
137                "type": "function",
138                "function": {
139                    "name": "extract_query_metadata",
140                    "description": "Extract structured metadata from user query and improve the query text using conversation history.",
141                    "parameters": {
142                        "type": "object",
143                        "properties": {
144                            "improved_query": {
145                                "type": "string",
146                                "description": "Improved/enriched version of the query that resolves pronouns and adds context from conversation history",
147                            },
148                            "original_query": {
149                                "type": "string",
150                                "description": "Original user query as provided",
151                            },
152                            "companies": {
153                                "type": "object",
154                                "description": "Companies mentioned in the query",
155                                "properties": {
156                                    "names": {
157                                        "type": "array",
158                                        "items": {"type": "string"},
159                                        "description": "List of company names mentioned",
160                                    },
161                                    "uuids": {
162                                        "type": "array",
163                                        "items": {"type": "string"},
164                                        "description": "List of company UUIDs if already known (optional, can be empty)",
165                                    },
166                                    "context": {
167                                        "type": "string",
168                                        "description": "Context about how companies are mentioned (e.g., 'acquirer', 'acquiree', 'target company')",
169                                    },
170                                },
171                            },
172                            "sectors": {
173                                "type": "array",
174                                "items": {"type": "string"},
175                                "description": "Sector/industry names mentioned (e.g., 'AI companies', 'fintech', 'healthcare startups')",
176                            },
177                            "investors": {
178                                "type": "object",
179                                "description": "Investors mentioned in the query (for investor portfolio queries)",
180                                "properties": {
181                                    "names": {
182                                        "type": "array",
183                                        "items": {"type": "string"},
184                                        "description": "List of investor names mentioned",
185                                    },
186                                },
187                            },
188                            "time_period": {
189                                "type": "object",
190                                "description": "Time period mentioned in the query",
191                                "properties": {
192                                    "start": {
193                                        "type": "string",
194                                        "description": "Start date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS) or null if not mentioned",
195                                    },
196                                    "end": {
197                                        "type": "string",
198                                        "description": "End date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS) or null if not mentioned",
199                                    },
200                                    "granularity": {
201                                        "type": "string",
202                                        "enum": ["monthly", "quarterly", "yearly"],
203                                        "description": "Time granularity if mentioned, or null",
204                                    },
205                                },
206                            },

208                                "type": "object",
209                                "description": "Amounts mentioned in the query",
210                                "properties": {

213                                        "description": "Minimum fundraise amount in USD or null",
214                                    },

216                                        "type": "integer",
217                                        "description": "Maximum fundraise amount in USD or null",
218                                    },
219                                    "valuation_min": {
220                                        "type": "integer",
221                                        "description": "Minimum valuation in USD or null",
222                                    },
223                                    "valuation_max": {
224                                        "type": "integer",
225                                        "description": "Maximum valuation in USD or null",
226                                    },
227                                    "acquisition_price_min": {
228                                        "type": "integer",
229                                        "description": "Minimum acquisition price in USD or null",
230                                    },
231                                    "acquisition_price_max": {
232                                        "type": "integer",
233                                        "description": "Maximum acquisition price in USD or null",
234                                    },
235                                },
236                            },
237                            "funding_stages": {
238                                "type": "array",
239                                "items": {"type": "string"},
240                                "description": "Funding stages mentioned (e.g., 'seed', 'series_a', 'series_b', 'late_stage_venture', 'ipo')",
241                            },
242                            "query_intent": {
243                                "type": "string",
244                                "enum": [
245                                    "find_funding_rounds",
246                                    "find_investor_portfolio",
247                                    "find_acquisitions",
248                                    "find_organizations",
249                                    "analyze_sector_trends",
250                                ],
251                                "description": "Query intent classification",
252                            },
253                            "reasoning": {
254                                "type": "string",
255                                "description": "Reasoning for query improvement and metadata extraction decisions",
256                            },
257                        },
258                        "required": ["improved_query", "original_query", "reasoning"],
259                    },
260                },
261            }
262
263            # Build system prompt using prompt manager
264            prompt_manager = get_prompt_manager()
265            system_prompt = prompt_manager.build_system_prompt(
266                base_prompt=self._base_prompt,
267                options=PromptOptions(add_temporal_context=False, add_markdown_instructions=False),
268            )
269
270            # Build user prompt with conversation history if available
271            user_prompt_parts = [f"User Query: {query}"]
272
273            if conversation_history:
274                history_lines = []
275                for msg in conversation_history[-10:]:  # Last 10 messages for context
276                    role = msg.get("role", "unknown")
277                    content = msg.get("content", "")
278                    history_lines.append(f"{role.capitalize()}: {content}")
279
280                if history_lines:
281                    user_prompt_parts.append(
282                        "\n\nPrevious conversation:\n" + "\n".join(history_lines)
283                    )
284
285            user_prompt_parts.append(
286                "\n\nImprove this query and extract all relevant metadata. "
287                "Resolve any pronouns using the conversation history. "
288                "Call the extract_query_metadata function with your analysis."
289            )
290
291            user_prompt_content = "\n".join(user_prompt_parts)
292
293            user_prompt = prompt_manager.build_user_prompt(
294                user_query=user_prompt_content,
295                options=PromptOptions(add_temporal_context=True),
296            )
297
298            # Call LLM with function calling
299            result = await generate_llm_function_response(
300                prompt=user_prompt,
301                tools=[extract_metadata_tool],
302                system_prompt=system_prompt,
303                model="gpt-4.1-mini",
304                temperature=0.3,
305                tool_choice={
306                    "type": "function",
307                    "function": {"name": "extract_query_metadata"},
308                },
309            )
310
311            # Parse result
312            if isinstance(result, dict) and "function_name" in result:
313                if result["function_name"] == "extract_query_metadata":
314                    args = result["arguments"]
315
316                    # Ensure original_query is set
317                    if "original_query" not in args or not args["original_query"]:
318                        args["original_query"] = query
319
320                    # Ensure improved_query is set (fallback to original if not provided)
321                    if "improved_query" not in args or not args["improved_query"]:
322                        args["improved_query"] = args.get("original_query", query)
323
324                    # Create metadata object and validate
325                    try:
326                        metadata = ExtractedQueryMetadata(**args)
327                        metadata_dict = metadata.model_dump()
328
329                        logger.info(
330                            f"Query enriched: '{query[:50]}...' -> "
331                            f"'{metadata_dict['improved_query'][:50]}...'"
332                        )
333
334                        # Optionally resolve company names to UUIDs (non-blocking best-effort)
335                        metadata_dict = await self._maybe_resolve_company_uuids(metadata_dict)
336
337                        return {
338                            "improved_query": metadata_dict["improved_query"],
339                            "original_query": metadata_dict["original_query"],
340                            "metadata": metadata_dict,
341                        }
342                    except Exception as e:
343                        logger.warning(
344                            f"Failed to validate extracted metadata: {e}, using raw args",
345                            exc_info=True,
346                        )
347                        # Use raw args if validation fails
348                        return {
349                            "improved_query": args.get("improved_query", query),
350                            "original_query": args.get("original_query", query),
351                            "metadata": args,
352                        }
353                else:
354                    logger.warning(
355                        f"Unexpected function call: {result.get('function_name')}, "
356                        f"using original query"
357                    )
358            else:
359                logger.warning(
360                    f"LLM did not make expected function call. Got: {type(result)}, "
361                    f"using original query"
362                )
363
364        except Exception as e:
365            logger.error(f"Query enrichment failed: {e}, using original query", exc_info=True)
366
367        # Fallback: return original query with empty metadata
368        empty_metadata = ExtractedQueryMetadata(improved_query=query, original_query=query)
369        return {
370            "improved_query": query,
371            "original_query": query,
372            "metadata": empty_metadata.model_dump(),
373        }
374
375    async def _maybe_resolve_company_uuids(
376        self, metadata_dict: Dict[str, Any], max_names: int = 3
377    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
378        """
379        Best-effort optional resolution of company names to UUIDs.
380
381        - Non-blocking: failures are logged and ignored.
382        - Limited to a few names to avoid latency.
383        """
384        companies = metadata_dict.get("companies") or {}
385        names = companies.get("names") or []
386
387        # If UUIDs already present or no names, nothing to do
388        existing_uuids = companies.get("uuids") or []
389        if existing_uuids or not names:
390            return metadata_dict
391
392        resolved: List[str] = []
393        for name in names[:max_names]:
394            try:
395                orgs_output = await get_organizations(name_ilike=name, limit=1)
396                if orgs_output.success and orgs_output.result:
397                    uuid = orgs_output.result[0].get("org_uuid")
398                    if uuid:
399                        resolved.append(str(uuid))
400            except Exception as e:
401                logger.warning(f"UUID resolution failed for '{name}': {e}")
402                continue
403
404        # Attach resolved UUIDs if any found; keep names regardless
405        if resolved:
406            metadata_dict["companies"] = {
407                **companies,
408                "uuids": resolved,
409            }
410
411        return metadata_dict

Service for enriching user queries and extracting structured metadata.

QueryEnrichmentService() 
71    def __init__(self):
72        """Initialize the query enrichment service."""
73        self._base_prompt = """You are a query enrichment and metadata extraction assistant. Your job is to:
74
751. **Improve the query**: 
76   - Resolve pronouns (e.g., "it", "they", "that company") using conversation history
77   - Add missing context from previous messages
78   - Make the query more specific and clear
79   - Preserve the original intent and meaning
80
812. **Extract structured metadata**:
82   - Identify company names mentioned (extract as list)
83   - Identify sector/industry names mentioned
84   - Identify investor names mentioned (for investor portfolio queries)
85   - Extract time periods (convert relative terms like "last year" to ISO dates)
86   - Extract funding amounts (convert mentions like "over $1M" to numeric values)
87   - Identify funding stages mentioned
88   - Classify query intent
89
90Rules:
91- Only extract information that is explicitly mentioned or clearly implied
92- For time periods, convert relative terms to ISO format dates (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS)
93- For amounts, convert to integers (USD)
94- Be conservative - only extract what you're confident about
95- Leave fields as empty/null if not mentioned
96- Query intent should be one of: find_funding_rounds, find_investor_portfolio, find_acquisitions, find_organizations, analyze_sector_trends"""

Initialize the query enrichment service.

Enrich query and extract metadata.

This method uses a single LLM call to both improve the query text and extract structured metadata. If query improvement succeeds but metadata extraction fails, the improved query is still returned with empty metadata.

Args: query: The user's query to enrich. conversation_history: Optional list of previous messages in the conversation. Each message should be a dict with 'role' and 'content' keys.

Returns: Dictionary containing: - improved_query: str - The improved/enriched query - original_query: str - The original query - metadata: Dict - ExtractedQueryMetadata as a dictionary

Raises: Exception: If enrichment completely fails, returns original query with empty metadata.

class ExtractedQueryMetadata(pydantic.main.BaseModel): 
26class ExtractedQueryMetadata(BaseModel):
27    """Structured metadata extracted from user query."""
28
29    improved_query: str = Field(
30        default="",
31        description="Improved/enriched version of the query that resolves pronouns and adds context from conversation history",
32    )
33    original_query: str = Field(default="", description="Original user query as provided")
34    companies: Dict[str, Any] = Field(
35        default_factory=dict,
36        description="Companies mentioned in the query. Structure: {names: List[str], uuids: List[str], context: str}",
37    )
38    sectors: List[str] = Field(
39        default_factory=list,
40        description="Sector/industry names mentioned in the query (e.g., 'AI companies', 'fintech', 'healthcare startups')",
41    )
42    investors: Dict[str, Any] = Field(
43        default_factory=dict,
44        description="Investors mentioned in the query. Structure: {names: List[str]}. Used for investor portfolio queries.",
45    )
46    time_period: Dict[str, Any] = Field(
47        default_factory=dict,
48        description="Time period mentioned in the query. Structure: {start: str (ISO format), end: str (ISO format), granularity: str (monthly/quarterly/yearly)}",
49    )
50    amounts: Dict[str, Any] = Field(
51        default_factory=dict,
52        description="Amounts mentioned in the query. Structure: {fundraise_min: int, fundraise_max: int, valuation_min: int, valuation_max: int, acquisition_price_min: int, acquisition_price_max: int}",
53    )
54    funding_stages: List[str] = Field(
55        default_factory=list,
56        description="Funding stages mentioned in the query (e.g., 'seed', 'series_a', 'series_b', 'late_stage_venture', 'ipo')",
57    )
58    query_intent: Optional[str] = Field(
59        default=None,
60        description="Query intent classification. One of: 'find_funding_rounds', 'find_investor_portfolio', 'find_acquisitions', 'find_organizations', 'analyze_sector_trends'",
61    )
62    reasoning: str = Field(
63        default="",
64        description="Reasoning for query improvement and metadata extraction decisions",
65    )

Structured metadata extracted from user query.

improved_query: str = ''

Improved/enriched version of the query that resolves pronouns and adds context from conversation history

original_query: str = ''

Original user query as provided

Companies mentioned in the query. Structure: {names: List[str], uuids: List[str], context: str}

sectors: List[str] = PydanticUndefined

Sector/industry names mentioned in the query (e.g., 'AI companies', 'fintech', 'healthcare startups')

investors: Dict[str, Any] = PydanticUndefined

Investors mentioned in the query. Structure: {names: List[str]}. Used for investor portfolio queries.

Time period mentioned in the query. Structure: {start: str (ISO format), end: str (ISO format), granularity: str (monthly/quarterly/yearly)}

amounts: Dict[str, Any] = PydanticUndefined

Amounts mentioned in the query. Structure: {fundraise_min: int, fundraise_max: int, valuation_min: int, valuation_max: int, acquisition_price_min: int, acquisition_price_max: int}

funding_stages: List[str] = PydanticUndefined

Funding stages mentioned in the query (e.g., 'seed', 'series_a', 'series_b', 'late_stage_venture', 'ipo')

query_intent: Optional[str] = None

Query intent classification. One of: 'find_funding_rounds', 'find_investor_portfolio', 'find_acquisitions', 'find_organizations', 'analyze_sector_trends'

reasoning: str = ''

Reasoning for query improvement and metadata extraction decisions
